body: It takes several weeks for one to notice the change St. John's does to his or her mind, and if you've been battling depression as I have/had, try it. Being happy feels great. Every couple months you may have to up your dosage. I'm 35. Never in my life have I been happy until 2 years ago when I began taking it. These days, instead of counting all the things that are wrong in my life, I've started counting those that are right. Need a change? Do it.
title: Do it

body: This stuff has been amazing.  I would say it *almost* makes me manic.  So a little too effective.  I hope my body doesn't get used to it, so I've only been taking it when I feel I need it. Everyone's physiology is a bit different, but I recommend trying it.  It seems to kick in for me after about an hour and lasts most of the day.  I'm not a herbal type person. I always thought herbal supplements were bogus, but at least this seems to work for me. I'm glad I decided to try it.
title: Can be very effective

body: I'd always been a happy person.... Until childbirth. Was treated for post partum depression with Prozac and gained 20lbs over 2 years with it. Finally got off Prozac and decided maybe it's not post partum anymore...I'm just depressed. Tried 5-htp and it did nothing for me. Went to St. John's wort, this was the first brand I tried. Within 2 weeks my mood was better.... Not the fake, happy-all-the-time feeling with Prozac, but a nice, normal feeling. No more hopelessness. Sure I have bad moods and at times I hate my job, etc., but I'm not moping about. Plus I've lost 10lbs and am able to maintain a healthy diet. I felt like on Prozac I couldn't... No willpower. Not sure if St. John's wort has an appetite-suppressant type thing to it, but it's been years since I've been able to stick to a diet and exercise program. I take 500mg in the am and again in the evening. I don't worry about whether I've eaten or not. I'm thinking that's a high dose? But it works and no side effects. I'm on my second bottle. I even recommended it to my mom who I think has the same cranky-type depression/anxiety as I do. Ps Unlike most other reviewers I was NOT compensated for this or any other review. I just hope this helps someone, maybe so they don't have to go to the shrinks, pay and arm and a leg, make inconvenient stops at the pharmacy and gain a ton of weight. Try this first!

Obviously it works for me, as I have continued to order this brand several times now! I take two of these at bedtime and one during the day. I used to take anti-depressants, but found that St. John's works for me as a mood enhancer and stress reliever. There are no side effects and it is perfectly safe to take. After being on an a pharmaceutical for a number of years and discontinuing it, I had many side effects. The main side effect was that I now have constant ringing in my ears.  After the Dr discovered that I was tired all of the time due mainly to a Thyroid disorder and low vitamin D, I decided to try St John's Wort along with my other supplements. I have been pharmaceutical free, except for Thyroid medicine, since 2014 and feel great. I suggest that if you are thinking about trying St. John's that you do some research and talk to your Dr about it. European countries have been using it successfully for a long time. I see a Dr who combines modern medicine with holistic medicine to treat the whole body.

body: So...I thought I had struck gold and it turned out to be gold plating I guess. First I want to say that I rarely write reviews anymore, but with the large amount of consumers being paid to do so, I FELT THE NEED TO WRITE A REAL ONE! I went to see my Pricare doctor in October and we were finally at the point where prescription drugs were an option. I had an open mind about it at first and after 3 days of being on them and not feeling like me, I decided I wanted to take another route. So I did some research online and found that St. John's wort helps with depression and anxiety, and I suffer with both. Upon day 2 of taking 2 a day of these... I felt WONDERFUL! I started feeling like myself again. I was getting things done, not feeling tired all day, wanting to get dressed up, go out and face the day...this feeling went on for about a week and then...NOTHING! So happy I didn't write a review after that week like I almost did b/c I can't believe how quickly things changed and it all just went away and never came back. I even tried upping the dose to 3 a day and nothing. I was so disappointed b/c I truly thought I had finally found something that works and my prayers were answered. I'm wondering if the pills at the top were good and as I kept going they were just placebo's. Either way I'm at square one again and very disappointed!
title: I don't know what happened...

body: This is -- BY FAR -- the worst grade health supplement I've ever consumed.  I routinely take health supplements daily, especially St. John's Wort.  I've NEVER had a problem with ANY other brand EXCEPT for this one.  So...what's the problem, you ask?  I get terrible stomach aches within 30 minutes of consuming this supplement...and I only take 1 capsule.  Imagine Freddy Krueger ripping your stomach out with his knife fingers from the inside out of your stomach and that's what it feels like taking these capsules.  It's the worst pain ever.  At first I thought it was a fluke.  I didn't take any for a few days then tried again.  Same stomach pain as before.  Then I stopped taking these for 2 weeks.  I resumed taking the rest of the other St. John's Wort brand I had.  Then I ran out of the other brand and took 1 capsule of these.  I was nearly doubled over in pain, the stabbing stomach pains were that bad.  This is, hands down, the single WORST health supplement capsule I've ever taken and I've taken A LOT in my 40+ years on this planet.  Not only am I throwing these in the trash (since they won't take them back) but I'll never purchase anything from VitaStrength ever again.  There's something wrong with the quality of their product and I can't help but to wonder if they are manufacturing their capsules in China or elsewhere and falsely labeling it a Made in the USA product, as many off-brand supplements have recently been found out as doing by the FDA.  If you don't want stomach pain, don't take these.  If you love the thought of feeling like you have 10 bleeding ulcers in your stomach while doubling over in pain, then these are highly recommended for you.

body: Have used St.John's Wort for over 20 years.  When I first started, I didn't notice any change, but my family did!  It took a while for me to notice a 'lightness' in mood that was different.  Over the years whenever I've run out and stopped taking it for a while...my family notices and reminds me to keep taking it.  Now, I'm on a ordering schedule so I never run out :) If you are new to using St. John's Wort...be patient.  It can take several weeks to reach full effectiveness in your body. It also takes a while to 'leave' the body after stopping use, so there is no problem with weaning off...you just stop taking it.  Also be aware that it is a blood thinner and some people may be more sensitive to that aspect.  It may also cause sun sensitivity, so be careful about sun exposure.  I haven't had a problem with either of these issues myself.  This brand is very good quality and a great price!

The "Why" is not exactly understood, but it seems to keep more serotonin in certain parts of the brain. I was taking the recommended dose for two months, and I would say my mood has improved over that time. Perhaps I also noticed a mild increase in lethargy as well, but I am not so sure. The only issue is that I did not really notice a decrease in anxiety, which was my main target. However, I am still going to continue taking a small dose.

body: I rarely leave product feedback, but felt compelled to after having taken this supplement for several weeks. I've dealt with moderate to severe anxiety and depression for almost a decade now, and can't remember ever having felt as good as I do now. I chose the lavender cap (90 day supply) as another review said it was better than the green. It turns out that the lavender cap is standardized, while the green is not. Apparently, all this means is that lavender is more or less guaranteed to have .3% hypericin, while the amount in the green can vary slightly do to varying amounts in the plants used. I have noticed a moderate decrease in anxiety, and a major increase in positive moods. As the symptoms of depression have abated, I've noticed I have more energy, more patience, and am generally a happier person. I also notice that I am better able to focus throughout the day. I have not noticed any side effects. Everyone's body will react differently, but as someone who has played the medication game, I would suggest giving this more natural route a try.
title: Color me surprised.

I immediately read several articles and studies that indicated this product has been available for ever and worked on a number of symptoms.  The most important is that it's natural.  I decided to purchase and give it a try. After taking as directed for 3 days, I could feel the difference in body.  The bank pain had reduced tremendously and although I did not have other symptoms I noticed my mood or ability to think without the fog was a lot better.  I continue to take the capsules and now I have no more pain.  I was surprised how well it worked.

body: Depression is a predictable side effect of taking Insulin for more than 20 years.  Depression killed my mother because she became addicted to the drugs she was taking to deal with it and eventually committed suicide.  I knew depression was coming for me and I was determined to deal with it.  Depression is a very real thing I found out, not just sad but held down, literally depressed.  From my research I knew that St. Johns Wart is the first choice for treating depression in Europe so I took one capsule.  15 minutes later I realized that I was no longer being held down.  A friend who also suffered from depression was on powerful drugs.  I was able to get him onto the wart.  I called him and asked if he was still depressed.  He said he was not depressed but he did not feel different.  Art went back to the drugs and died shortly after.  He had gotten use to the rush of the powerful drugs.  This is why the wart should always be used before habit forming drugs.  I only take it occasionally maybe 5 caps a month when I am feeling down, it helps.  The wart also balances Melatonin which I also take occasionally.
title: Take this before drugs

Like I said,  I originally purchased for my carpel tunnel issues, but it was great that it also helped feel less crappy. body: I have been taking St. John's Wort for years.  I know that it is not "officially" prescribed for depression, but it has kept mine in check.  I still suffer from it, but this product does work because I have taken "breaks" from it and have determined that I am better off with it.  Most manufacturers only offer 300 mg.  I take two of these 350 mg capsules and think the higher dose works better.  The only reason that I gave it a "4 star" review is because I know it's a somewhat controversial product and everyone's response to it is subjective, so I cannot definitively recommend it to others as effective for them.  It works for me, though.

body: I’ve been looking for some supplements that would help with stabilizing my mood, and generally improving the condition of my depression and anxiety. I had been taking prescription anti-depressants for three years, but they left me feeling so numb that I made it my mission to make a change. The anti-depressants left me feeling like I was sort of in a void, rather than capable of happy feelings and joy. So, after another year of my life down the drain, I started my journey into natural supplements and other ways to self medicate. I initially read in a women’s health blog that St. John’s wort was great for helping with this, and despite an initial wariness towards the product I decided to give it a shot. I started taking 1 or 2 capsules a day, and after about two weeks, I noticed huge improvement in my mood, and my capacity to manage my emotions and moods. My anxiety was way more manageable than it had been, and I was actually making huge improvements in my personal life. I was also recommended a second supplement,
title: Great for aiding depression, anxiety, sleep deprivation

body: I've been fighting depression for years; took a number of prescription anti-depressants, tolerated the side effects. Finally, I completely changed my life, moved west, found happiness. Got married, progressed in my career, got my son... everything I wanted. Yay! So why, after 6 years, do I begin to feel down again? Panic attacks at work, can't get up in the morning, life's little joys lack luster... (I can answer that, actually, it's that aforementioned career...). I start considering the medications again, but...  I don't want them. I remember how awful they used to make me feel. I remember the dry mouth, the missing libido, the head in the clouds. I don't want it!
title: I'm a believer

body: I've suffered from depression at an early age (35 now) and was on prozac for about 8 years. Life got a lot better and I haven't had to take anything for the last 14 years. Decided to test out St. John's Wort for the anti-depression effects, to see what it would do. This product is amazing...
title: Amazing product

body: St. John's wort has given me my life back! I have suffered from PTSD for most of my life. I have been taking  St. John's wort for 4 months now and it has truely given me back my confidence and happiness. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who wants to enjoy life again and be relaxed and happy!
title: St. John's Wort has given me my life back!!

body: This is my first time trying St. John's Wort. I've never been diagnosed with depression or anxiety, but I've always been a bit gloomy... Maybe I'm just a dark person? Anyway a lot of things in my life changed and I was having trouble bouncing back like I usually do from stressors. Being in the medical profession, I know how serious the side effects of pharmaceuticals can be, plus I don't really trust them enough to try them unless I REALLY needed to.. And I'm not depressed (sleep/eating schedules aren't altered, no suicidal ideation, still functioning day to day etc.).
title: Seeing the forest through the trees

Anger issues with me - he's doing so much better.  His father seriously says St John's Wort saved his marriage.

When I take as directed, I felt much calmer and not as anxious. The effect was almost immediate- after taking my morning dose, I was much calmer throughout the day. body: About two years ago I had very high blood pressure, and was sent to the ER, because my doctor thought I was having a heart attack.  After being in the ER the entire day and having a myriad of tests done, it turns out I suffered a severe anxiety attack.  They gave me xanax which helped to calm me down, and it also brought my blood pressure down.  However, the next day I could feel my anxiety coming back and have been having issues with anxiety since that time.  My doctor put me on two different daily anti-anxiety meds, but both of them gave me severe headaches as well as dizziness.  I was given a prescription of xanax to use ONLY when needed, but I still had anxiety on a daily basis, and my blood pressure was normally on the higher side.  After that I decided to go the natural route, and I tried Passion Flower, Valerian Root, and Chamomile but NONE of them did anything for my anxiety.  Then I found many people had success with St. John's Wort, so I thought I would give it a try as my last shot before going back to meds.  Within a few days I felt calmer and more rested than I have been since first being diagnosed with anxiety.  After two weeks I hardly had any daily anxiety, and, most importantly, my blood pressure came down a LOT.  I've been taking Nature's Bounty St. John's Wort every day now, and it has literally changed my life.  I HIGHLY recommend this for ANYONE who suffers with anxiety, as it changed my life.
title: For anxiety, this CHANGED my life!!!

body: Very effective. Check German research on how effective product is in treating slight depression. Very safe, no side effect of weight gain or rebound depression, suicidal thought or homicidal ideation that most prescription medications have. Taper yourself off when you don't need any longer to avoid headache and severe fluctuations in brain chemical balances. Does have a slight risk of increased sun sensitivity. If you burn easy normally, be aware and use precautions. Even though I knew it was awesome & I did my research, I still told my doctor I was taking it.for me, I use it to help deal with the stress of elderly parent living with me and young children. It takes the edge off. I even notice myself getting 'ticked off' easily when I am late on or forget the mid-day dose. While most research shows it effective for depression, I use it for the mood swings and it helps me stay more even keeled!

body: Before I begin this review, I would like to say that depression is a horrible, sinking and debilitating ILLNESS that ruins lives, relationships and potential. It is very difficult to explain to a non-depressed individual, and it does not resonate with them nearly as much as it should. I also direct my review towards people with moderate-severe depression, NOT mild depression. I mention these facts to convey my sense of empathy but also to give legitimacy to what I am about to say:
title: I offer a different and unpopular solution that involves commitment, despite the positive reviews of this product

I don't know but these pills are really potent and although it takes about a week to have an effect, they are amazing and help me feel better instantly. I like to look for herbal alternatives before I start taking any prescription meds because well I try to put less toxins in my body if possible. I would definitely recommend these as you have nothing to lose. The pills aren't too big or too small...just right.
title: Great value

body: My husband developed crippling depression over the summer, though we didn't identify it as that at first.  It started with a disturbance in his sleep - where he would wake up every morning at 6am, no matter what time he went to bed, with a heavy weight in his chest and a sense of dread. Those feelings would stick with him all day. He lost interest in all of his favorite activities, coming home only to lay on the couch or bed and stare at the ceiling. His appetite decreased. Since I work with individuals with mental health disorders, I gave him a mental health battery to see if that's what was going on, and he was off the charts on the depression scale.  Unfortunately, this was also a time when we didn't have health insurance. I knew about St. John's Wort, but was leery about over the counter supplements, as they aren't FDA regulated and often don't contain what they say they do.  I did a lot of research to determine which brand to use, and Solaray came up near the top of the list, and was also reasonably priced. So I ordered it and he gave it a try.  After about 2.5 weeks, he noticed the sense of dread/weight in his chest was lessening about half-way through the day.  His energy and appetite started to pick up.  Between 3 and 4 weeks after starting, he started to sleep a little longer, and he was back to doing some of his activities.  He still had dread/weight every few days or so, but to a lesser extent.  Today, he is on his last pill in the bottle, so it's been 2 months, and he's back to his old self.  No signs of depression left. There hasn't been any side effects either. We have health insurance again, so he told his doctor about the ordeal and the St. John's Wort.  His doctor approved of what we did and was thrilled that it worked for us. She is recommending that he continue to take St. John's Wort, as opposed to switching to traditional anti-depressents. (We wouldn't have switched anyway, but wanted her opinion as a medical professional).  So, I highly recommend this product.  You do need to give it time to work - and we stuck with it realizing this. It was a slow recovery, but totally worth it.  We are so thankful he is feeling better.

body: I bought this product for my husband. He has been struggling with severe depression for several years and has been on different anti-depressant prescriptions over time. He eventually let his prescription run out, pretty much giving up on them. I allowed time for the prescription to clear out of his system first (about three weeks). He agreed to try Solaray 900 mg, once a day pills for a month. It took about three weeks before his depression began lifting, but WOW the positive changes it made! No side effects for him to endure, and the once-per-day dosing is a bonus! I feel like I have my husband back!

body: I've suffered from panic disorder and general anxiety nearly half my life now.  I've had bad luck overall with prescribed meds in terms of side effects. The only thing that semi-helped was Xanax.  I recently lost my medical insurance so I decided to try this out.  I've only been taking it for about a week now and I already feel a difference in my overall mood.  I haven't had any panic attacks.  I just seem more relaxed overall.  I feel more positive/hopeful.  Not only is my mood better, but my muscle tension is also subsiding.  I'm taking this combined with TwinLab's Vitamin B Stress Complex.  If you ever tried Xanax, this pretty much gives the same effect. body: It is a mild anti depressant and mood booster. The plant has bright golden yellow flowers and it is supposed to bring good cheer to a person. I like it well enough for an extra bit of sunshine in my life. It is non addictive however I prefer to have it on hand so I do think it comes in handy. If you get easily discouraged by the negative moods of others or you are happy when others are happy and a bit on the sensitive side,  then this is sort of like a bit of extra help to stay positive. It is far from being strong medicine and if you have serious depression I am sure this may not do however as a preventative and home remedy I recommend it. Something about it feels good to me. Not a replacement for medical treatment but a true and tried herb in Europe that can take the blues out of the weather or a bad day. Nothing major but it works over time in a supportive way. I like it and this is a good version. One a day is sufficient for me and it lasts several month with 150 in there so quite economical. It is also supposed to help with PMS and menopause and has anti-inflammatory properties. In Germany they use St John's Wort oil against arthritis and other pains of the nerves topically. It is also used to treat skin cancer.  I read it may interact with prescription medicine so double check with your doctor if you are on an anti-depressant before you take it internally or have serious health concerns however I have nothing but good things to say about St John's Wort as a mood booster for a normally healthy person and have never noticed any side effects whatsoever.
title: Cheers your mood

body: Perika is not the alternative to SSRI medications that I had hoped for, as the effects are minimal to slightly moderate. I will say, though, it takes the edge off my otherwise angst-filled state, so much so that I have resigned my self to continuing with SJW long term in lieu of RX drugs. I attribute this calming effect to the hyperforin content, as I've experimented with the Nature's Bounty brand of SJW (low in hypferforin) to no avail and without results of any kind for that matter.
title: Slight-to-Moderate Relief

body: I just got this product sat. Started it sat. It takes a while for st Johns wort. I have never tried it before. I am using both kinds of st Johns wort. After research there is a hyperforin and a hypericin. I am trying both. Hyperforin which is in this product, is hard to find and is what all the research was done on. I will let you know in a couple weeks.
title: so far so good. hyperforin is what was tested in clinical tests. in this product. Reordered.

body: I began to notice a slight effect about 2-3 weeks after taking Perika. I have been on antidepressants in the past and did not like the side effects. The only side effect I experienced from the St. John's Wort was a slight upset stomach, but if I took it with food it seemed to help. If you've never tried it before, I would highly recommend it. I felt so much better and brighter after about 4-6 weeks and continued to improve after that. Give it at least 2-3 months for it to take full effect. Be patient, it's worth it!
title: It worked for me!

body: I take 3 of these every day.  There are no side effects.  You can start it up and stop it w/o withdrawal like drugs.  I ended up taking all 900 mg at one time first thing in the morning.  So far, no problem taking it on an empty stomach.  You can do 300 mg 3X a day or all at once in the morning, since it  stays in your system 24 hours until the next morning.  It's not recommended to take it later in the day too close to bed as it may keep you from a solid night's sleep.  It mellows my mood.  It can be safely used in conjunction with Sam-e.  You cannot take ST. John's Wort with just any other supplements or prescription drugs, so research it first as to what is safe.  If you are using it for depression, consider a few other ideas to combat your depression as well,  which I have found helpful from researching it:  Regular exercise, healthy diet, sunlight.  I use a 10,000 lux light therapy lamp which is safe with no UV rays to regulate my mood and promote sleep.  45 minutes each day at my desk each morning, especially in the cooler/darker months unless you live far south and get lots of sun.  I also take 3000 I.U. Vitamin D3, especially in non-summer months.  This is the D3 you need, which you could get from being in the sun, but probably aren't doing.  Also, getting enough sleep at night.
title: St. Johns may be a  possibility for helping to lift your depression

body: I've been taking this 3x/day for over a year now. For me, it has been very effective in controlling mild-moderate anxiety and the associated aches and pains. I occasionally take a 4th pill if it seems necessary. I have not noticed any side effects. This is one of the most well-studied formulations of St John's Wort, and there seems to be strong evidence for its effectiveness. The quality of the pills and packaging has been consistently high, and it subjectively seems to work better for me than other brands.
title: A good quality St John's product.

body: I was skeptical about buying Perika because I've taken other St John's Wort supplements in the past that have had no effect whatsoever. I liked the reviews and that these were tablets, not capsules so I decided to give it a try. I've been taking 3 tablets per day for over a month and I do notice a difference in the way I feel. Just calmer and more clear headed. Not so stressed out. I take all 3 at the same time in the morning or at lunch. I'm really pretty pleased with it.
title: For Me, It Does Make A Difference

body: It's cheaper to buy it here and get two bottles at once than to buy it at the nearest vitamin shop in town!  I've been using Perika St. John's Wort tablets for several months now to combat SAD and general mild depression, and it's definitely made a difference. It's helped me go from wanting to just lie down and give up to being productive again, without a ton of side effects (though I don't take any other medications--be careful combining St. John's Wort with other things, as it has adverse effects with LOTS of other drugs and supplements).  I know it doesn't work for everyone, but it sure does help me.
title: Effective and less expensive than at the store

body: I've been taking Perika for a few weeks now to treat depression, having been referred to me as a very reliable brand of St. John's Wort. I was very skeptical before I started using it, but now I'm positive that Perika has been having beneficial effects on my mood, anxiety levels, and general demeanor. It's far from a magical cure-all pill, but it helps a lot more than you'd think. The only side effect I'm experiencing is increased light sensitivity which is actually kind of annoying when there's a lot of snow on the ground reflecting sunlight, but this is easily taken care of by making sure to wear sunglasses on sunny days.
title: Worked for me!

body: St John's Wort has worked well for me. Consumer lab ranks this brand among the best of the affordable ones, so I went with it. I think it may have dampened by 'drive' a bit, but I think that's because some of my drive stems from anxiety. It's not a miracle. I'm still me, thoughts and all, but it's definitely put a bit of padding over the corners of my mind so that when I bump into places that aren't as pleasant, it doesn't hurt as much.
title: Been feeling down for a couple months, partly life situation, partly just my disposition.

body: Over the years I have taken several St. John's Wort products.  Many vary widely in their consistency and potency, with some bottles working well, and others (same product) not working at all.  Nature's Way Perika formula is always consistent, and does not vary in strength or effectiveness.
title: Consistent formula / potency

body: Perika sent in Feb 2016 is well within use by date (July 2018).  I prefer Perika to other forms of St. John's wort because it is standardized.  It works for me.  My dosage suggestion is to start with 1 tablet once a day for a week or even two and increase only if needed.  St. John's wort takes a while to work.

body: It took a couple of weeks until I could feel an effect, and it was so subtle that I thought it was just a mood change. But after a few more weeks of feeling quite well, I decided it was probably thanks to SJW. In comparison with prozac I would say the change is much less dramatic, but I do not mind. In fact, I still feel like I am myself, only without the very low moods. No more depressive evenings, no more feeling of despair. When I lay in bed at night and think of things that used to make me feel almost suicidal, now I am sort of able to look at them from a more distant point, and not get emotionally affected.
title: more helpful than I expected

body: Worked really well for my arthritis inflammation. Just in case your wondering SJW is a really good inflammation reducer. BUT after several months i developed severe migraines and facial twitching. After I stopped taking the SJW the migraines and twitching went away. It's a shame because my arthritis had very few flare ups with this stuff. So be careful when taking herbal supplements. The side effects can be mild to severe to nonexistent. Always check with your doctor first.

body: My 15 year old son has been struggling with depression for a couple of years.  He does not want to take an Rx, so I have been desperate to find a supplement that would actually work for him.  Sam-e and Curemed did absolutely nothing for him.  So far, St. John's Wort is the only one that seems to make a difference.  After a couple of weeks on Perika, he appears less distant, less angry, was more engaged in conversations and, every now and then, we even see him smile.  Started him on 300 mg twice a day for a week, then increased his dose to 300 mg three times a day.  I know there are negatives that go along with this supplement, but it breaks through the depression and that's the most important thing.
title: Helped 15 y.o. son

body: For starters, do NOT add ANY St. John's Wort formula to your antidepressant prescription, talk to your doctor first, ALWAYS. Many prescription anti-depressants work along the same mechanism as St. John's Wort in the brain and you could end up with a serotonin storm. Your really, really don't want that as you just might not survive it.

body: Worked well for mood, 2 stars. After two weeks tho, half of my body began tingling numb. Of course went to ER when it spread to my face. Turns out a little known side effect of SJW is myelin sheath damage from being in the sun. I live in the night and so Coincidently the half of my body and face that went numb is the side that gets hit by the sun while driving home in the AM.  Be warned.  Wear long sleeves and sun hats in ANY sun while on this, as recommended by doctors who prescribe it in Europe.  Apparently it takes 2-3 weeks for SJW To leave your system completely, and several months after for the sheath to repair naturally.

body: I've been breastfeeding exclusively for 8 months now, pumping at work, and I really think this tea has helped to maintain supply. I have been drinking 2-3 cups/ day of this tea (though sometimes I forget and have none). My daughter drinks alot more milk from bottles then when she breastfeeds, so keeping up with her daily ounces on daycare days can sometimes be a challenge. When I have a low pumping day, I up it to about 6 cups of this tea; I also try to drink more water, sometimes add oatmeal. Something works-- supply is back up in a day or two. I usually drink alot of water, so I do tend to attribute the increase in milk to this tea. And I like the taste. Price is right in cases of 6 from  Amazon, even cheaper if you do the auto shipments.
title: I think it works

body: I can't get enough of this tea! The experience starts when you tear open the envelope and inhale the gorgeous aromas of cinnamon, cloves and ginger. Continue enjoying the calming scent as your tea steeps in the hot water and meditat on the little pearl of wisdom written on each tag. Finally, in 3 to 5 minutes when you drink your tea, you'll start to realize while no other green chai tea will ever measure up again. This is the best - truly, therapy in a cup. But please note: if you're not used to chai tea, it may take a few cups to get used to - I think it's a little stronger than other chai. The traditional way to drink this is with sweetener and a little milk, although I prefer mine with just hot water. Often I will throw a thimble-sized amount of peeled and chopped fresh ginger root into my mug and leave it in there as an extra health and flavor boost while I drink my tea. Heavenly!
title: Therapy in a cup!

body: Well, it speaks volumes that I have already purchased seven packages of this Stomach Ease Tea, and all my packages contained six boxes of sixteen tea bags. It soothes my often irritated tummy and mind, is caffeine free, and I adore the positive, inspiring quotes printed on each tea bag label! They start my day (or end my evening) with comfort and positivity. Sometimes, I even leave these little quotes on the door or fridge at a friend's house. Surprise! Jen was here, and she was thinking of you. :) We can all use a little perspective and gratitude for the goodness in our lives.
title: A Peaceful Mind and Tummy...Ahhhh.

title: Fantastic tea

body: I like the Yogi teas in general because I drink tea all day long, and while you would expect to get a good steeping or two from their teabags, I can really just enjoy my tea all day long, with the same teabags that I used at 8am!
title: Good Tea, Great Flavor

body: I am not a fan of tea. I do not normally drink the stuff, any flavor, any type, for any symptom. BUT, I am now a believer. This tea is amazing. I suffer from severe cramps (Yes, I do cry because of it.. I even sometimes ask my sister to punch me in the stomach so that it would take away from the pain!). I have tried prescription pain medication and birth control to alleviate my pain. The prescription pain meds always made me sleepy (which is terrible while I'm at work, or need to drive) and for personal reasons I am not on birth control at the moment. When I wasn't taking either, I would take between 6-10 ibuprofen each day for the first 2 days of my cycle. Don't get me wrong, I still have to take it, but not nearly as much. So far, I have only drank the tea during the cycle, usually about 5 bags each day. I have done this for the past 3 months. But, I am going to start drinking it throughout the month... I'm hoping it will help the initial monstrous pain I get when my cycle decides to surprise me.
title: Cramps be gone

body: Best tasting tea I've ever had. I loved it so much that I had 2 cups every night for 2 weeks without much thought. Fair warning for nursing moms, this tea SEVERELY reduces milk production. I'm not sure which ingredient does it, but it has a significant effect. This may be desirable if your weaning or using formula and not breastfeeding or pumping. Cut milk production by 90%.
title: Great taste, but nursing mothers beware!

body: The yogi tea and the traditional medicinal tea work very much the same and both have pleasant tastes that don't need added sweeteners like honey. With that being said, I feel that the yogi tea is a better fit because of the mint taste, especially if it's meant to be taken before bed. I've been irregular for a long time and the colon helper pills are way to big and chalky. This works great when you're constipated.
title: Very great taste!!!

body: This tea is literally magic. I tend to catch colds and general sickness more often than most it seems. I have a heart condition that tends to have a weakening effect on my immune system first off, I ride public transportation to work and back, and come home to 3 teenagers, one with severe special needs, who bring home all sorts of germs from school. It's rare that I go 2 months without missing a day of work for some sort of awful illness and then dealing with the aftermath of said illness for days to weeks thereafter.
title: Cold Season = Magic.

body: I'm not a tea drinker generally but in rehabbing my ankle trying to avoid ankle replacement surgery, I had to get my inflammation down and I was tired and reluctant to use prescription ibuprofen more than I already had to get thru tennis matches.
title: Converted Me to Tea

body: I love YOGI teas. They are my obsession in the tea realm. I buy them bulk and give one or two boxes to a friend. The bedtime tea is wonderful, so relaxing and calming.  Especially in the winter when it is cold,  I drink these every night. The flavor is a bit too "natural" for my husband so he has their Carmel Spice sleep tea (so tasty) and I have this one. I like the flavor but it is certainly quite herbal. But, who could complain about an herbal tea tasting herbal! I do seem to sleep better with the team but who knows if it's actually the tea or me just thinking it's the tea....Works for me, either way!
title: Tasty herbal tea, actually helps me drift to sleep.

body: Drink four to a cup after I work out. Wonderful painkiller. Use it nearly every day.
title: Joints are comforted...

body: I am a big fan of Yogi tea. They make great stuff. Always very high quality ingredients, very tasty blends. This is one of the 5-star varieties. Although it lists itself as chamomile and lavender, the flavor is predominantly a nice licorice, which combined with the other ingredients, is more like anise. It is also a moderately sweet tea. I'd call this a 'rich and full-bodied' herbal tea. And, although I'm not a big "traditional remedy" person, there do seem to be some real benefits to this and Relaxed Mind. However, it might be as much due to the enjoyment of a nice hot, flavorful cup of tea, as it is due to the herbs in the tea.
title: GREAT tea!

body: I love this stuff! I made the mistake of trying out the Nuva Ring when my doctor kind of guilted me into thinking that I need to he on birth control of some sort. HUGE mistake! My milk supply dwindled to almost half the very next day! I discontinued use of the birth control and immediately ordered this tea and some fenugreek capsules. My milk suplly started increasing by the third day of drinking this tea and taking the fenugreek. I'm not promising that it will work for you but I sure do swear by it. I'm not one ro err in the way of blind herbal remedies but this one actually works :-D
title: GREAT stuff...doesn't taste funny to me with honey :-D

body: My husband doesn't like most of the Yogi brand teas I've bought him. He loves this one. I will say that the taste is superb.  Because I have a sweet tooth, I do put some beet sugar rocks in the tea to sweeten it up a tad. Wonderful flavors. Has done wonders for my body so far. LOVE! A must try if you haven't!
title: Try this!!! Fully recommend!

body: This has been my favorite tea for 7 years now. The stress relief is just a bonus. The flavor is absolutely amazing.
title: This has been my favorite tea for 7 years now

body: Yogi Tea is always a favorite for me, especially during the winter months. This is a strong flavored green tea, caffeinated, a warm Rich Spice Chai Tea. Add honey, lemon, or drink as is you will be delighted with this tea.
title: Yogi Tea Chai Green, 16-count pkg, six boxes inside

body: Honestly I haven't felt the difference after drinking this tea for about half a year.

body: Perfect transaction & great tasting tea with a soothing relaxing effect. Price could be better but its still worth it. Might be worth looking into buying pure kava root if you want a better value but this tea has other ingredients that make it taste better so pure kava root may not be a better choice for everyone. Worth a try!

body: I love vanilla and I love hazelnut, but both seem to be lacking in this tea. The tea, however, does have a good full-bodied flavor. I think of this more as a spiced tea with cinnamon, ginger, and cloves prevailing. The tea brews up with plenty of flavor and has enough spice to make me want to drink it earlier in the day than as a nighttime relaxer. I think the name "Vanilla Hazelnut" is misleading, however.
title: not much vanilla, but good flavor

body: Quality non-caffeinated tea.  My co-workers love it as well, very popular during the COLD (health and temperature!) season.

body: I love yogi teas, but I especially love Breath Deep.  I smoked for 14 years and quit several years ago.  I still have a lot of phlegm.  I usually have a lung-butter attack between 2 and 4 hours of waking up.  I was taking mucinex but then I developed an allergy to fake dyes and had to stop taking it.  Now, I drink one 8 oz cup of breath deep tea as soon as I start feeling the mucous forming, and it clears up the issue within 30 minutes.  I also find that taking a walk a little while after drinking it can help to encourage anything that’s worth coughing out to come up.
title: Great alternative to Mucinex

body: Wanted to clean up my diet, cut caffeine and hit the reset button. Researched and this came up. I drink it in the morning and before bed. I think it even helps me sleep better at night.

body: I drank this product for almost 3 weeks till my period started and noticed a difference in pain levels. My pain level moved from excruciating to painful but bearable. I will continue to take this product, I heard taking it continuously together for months can tremendously help with period pain. It can also be combined with daily vitamins for best results. All the best to all sisters going through this pain!

body: I was suffering from the usual environmental issues of one winter cold after another, combined with getting over some sinus trouble, combined with allergies, and my sinuses and throat were all mucked up. Nothing was helping to clear it up. I thought I'd give this product a try after reading reviews here and after hearing rumors that singers, especially, favor another brand of throat-coat tea.

body: I drank this throughout my whole pregnancy (as well as ate decently well and exercised regularly), and I really think this had a lot to do with my easy labor. I did also take the tea in pill form from Vitacost. Either way, my first baby came out perfectly healthy after only 2 hours of labor and 20 minutes of pushing. I obviously cannot say that it is only because of the tea, but I recommend this to every woman - even if you're not pregnant, it is supposed to help a lot with your cycle. After I started ovulating again, I still took the tea and had less intense cycles than I used to. But definitely discuss anything you're taking with your doctor if you are pregnant or breastfeeding!
title: A MUST HAVE

body: I drank the “Earth Mama Angel Baby - Organic Third Trimester Tea” brand of for most of my pregnancy. Starting at about 9/10weeks and into the 3rd tri. I switched to this Yogi brand red raspberry leaf tea my third trimester because the Earth Mama Angel was out of stock. I enjoyed the flavor of this Yogi brand one a little better. They both were very tasty iced. Some women say its better with honey but I didn’t mind it plain. My midwife suggested 1 cup per day during the 1st trimester, 2cups 2nd, 3cups 3rd… Both teas are very mild and I found both tasty – they are both an excellent price to buy in bulk.
title: They say this preps you for a speedy labor... I am proof!

body: I use a combination of methods to increase my supply. I am still not pumping enough for all of my baby's feedings, but that is probably an individual problem. I did notice an increase after drinking this tea. I did however try other things to increase my supply. I drink one cup (doesn't taste good enough to have more) of the Mother's Milk Tea before bed, 2 Fenugreek in the morning and 2 at night, oatmeal for breakfast, a Gatorade/Powerade with lunch, and of course lots and lots of water. It may seem like a lot, but I am doing my best to make sure my baby has at least some breast milk as long as I can produce it.

Since it tastes so great, any pain relief is a bonus.

body: Peppermint tea is a staple in my house, so I've tried more than a few brands, and was reasonably content with most of them. However, none of them rivalled the strong minty-ness of a freshly brewed cup of peppermint tea ordered from a fancy cafe. Lately, I found myself on a quest for such a peppermint tea that I could brew at home. Yogi's "Purely Peppermint" is exactly that--strong, with the signature cooling sensation of a potent mint. It's so minty, in fact, that my husband, who prefers a milder mint, often passes it up. More for me I suppose!
title: My search ended here

body: With all the weight loss and anti-oxidant benefits of GREEN TEA, I've been a little shocked that not only are there not MORE "green" chai teas out there - but that most stores don't stock this Yogi version. But this brand is amazing and the perfect non-coffee day starter especially with a bit of organic whole milk/cream and a few drops of vanilla stevia.

So I tried this and 3 times a day, I brew 2 bags (sometimes a third bag of ginger tea) and I haven't had stomach pain in weeks! The taste isn't offensive (like the ginger...YUCK) and I find I'm benefiting from the additional liquids too.

body: I got this tea because my boyfriend and I are doing a juice fast and I wanted something else to sip on to get me through the hunger pangs. I had tried the Peach Detox & Fasting teas before and those were pretty good so I assumed I would like this one to...not so much! It has a weird herbal, anaseptic taste to it that I can not quite identify. In my opinion, it is just not a good flavor. And I as I said I am fasting so I do not want to add sugar, agave, stevia or honey right now. Honestly I don't think those flavors would complement it much anyway. But I have discovered that lemon does wonders. I am sure that any citrus flavor would help it a lot. But other than the taste, I think that it is great. Its almost like the master cleanse flavor.

body: It's hard to find this tea in stores, so it's great to find it in a 6-pack at a good price. For an added treat, add milk.  A great stress-reliever that I highly recommend.

body: I've been waiting to write a review on this product for a few months. I've suffered from chronic migraines specifically bad around my period for the past 15-20 years. I've tried everything!! I do not consume caffeine, alcohol, dairy, processed sugars or wheat/gluten so obviously food is not a trigger. I get plenty of sleep and exercise. I've tried EVERY migraine medicine with no changes. About 4 months ago I came across this tea and thought I'd give it a try. I had way fewer migraines that month so I kept with it. Around the same time I started seeing a chiropractor which has also been a huge help! I have gone from 15-20 migraines a month to none in the past 2 months! I think the key is to drink 1-2 tea bags throughout the month and I up it to 2-3 the week before and usually 4-5 right before and during. If you struggle with menstural migraines PLEASE try this!! Thank you Yogi Tea you have given me my life back!
title: CHANGED MY LIFE! No more migraines

body: I have been drinking this tea for a month.  1 cup daily starting during my period, then on day 12 (2 cups a day) then on day 23, 2-3 cups a day.  This has completely DONE AWAY WITH MY HOT FLASHES!!!  No more perimenopause symptoms, no joke.  A lot of our hormonal issues are due to estrogen fluctuations during the month.  This tea contains low level phytoestrogens that - when your hormones are too high- bring them down, and if they are too low, it fills in the gaps so your body doesn't panic - doing away with symptoms brought on by hormonal highs and lows.  Because of this tea, I stopped using the progesterone cream that I had been on for a year.  As a result, I lost 10 pounds, my skin cleared, and I don't get depressed the last half of the month - even sleeping 7 hours a night, with no night sweats- this stuff works miracles.  This tea gave me my life back.  Thank you yogi tea for researching this blend.  It is truly amazing and balancing when used as directed on the package!!!  5 plus stars!!!
title: It is truly amazing and balancing when used as directed on the package

body: Took this tea starting 36 weeks pregnant - drank 3 tall cups a day (two bags in each tall cup). By my 37 week checkup I was 2 cent. dialated and fully effaced! My labor started when my water broke at 3:15am when I was 38 weeks, I steeped a VERY strong potion of the raspberry tea and drank it right after my water broke (as I had read that this is where the magic of its power works!). I had an instant urge to push while gathering our stuff to get headed to the hospital. Hubby drove 90 mph down the highway hoping I wouldn't have the baby in the car. I got to the hospital, pushed only a handful of times and baby was born at 5am!!!!!!!! THIS TEA WORKS. Period. Truly believe the magic is in that strong potion during early labor though.! :):)  Side note:  Also really helped get my uterus back into shape, and also it doubled my milk supply to nurse.
title: Water broke at 3:15am, had baby after only a few pushes at 5am!!!!  THIS TEA WORKS. !!!

body: As an individual who has difficulty falling asleep, I have tried a number of natural products to make it easier to fall asleep. A friend recommended Yogi Bedtime Tea and I have found that it works well for me. I also found that it is wise for me to get in bed and drink it there, it works that well for me.

body: My wife and I both love coffee, and tea to a lesser extent. I've realized over the years that my preference for coffee is largely due to two factors: the strength of the flavor, and the 'thickness' of the drink. This is one of the few teas that rivals coffee in both departments. That's not to say it tastes anything like coffee--it is strong and aromatic, but sweet and almost nutty, not acidic or tending towards bitter. The hazelnut and vanilla flavors mingle quite nicely in this dark, expressive tea. Yogi makes some really fine teas, including this one.
title: Tea for a coffee lover

body: This has become one of my favorite teas - it is a delicious, smooth blend that requires no sugar. My husband even likes it. We've also found it to be an exceptional immune system booster. We've tried many different brands of echinacea capsules many times over the years, but this tea seems to be especially potent and quick-acting - maybe because it's a blend of 3 species of echinacea, and also includes astragalus & elderberry. It's a very enjoyable way to do something good for your body!
title: Outstanding Tea

body: Yogi Tea Throat Comfort Tea is what I consistently tote with me for Karaoke singing. This Yogi tea box talks about this tea supporting the respiratory system and soothing mucous membranes in the trachea, refers to it as a healing formula made with Slippery Elm Bark and Mullein, and talks about the herbs in this tea helping to form a protective slippery coating along the throat's mucous lining which the box says can be especially important for singers and public speakers, and mentions inclusion of Black Cherry Bark for soothing effects and pleasant cherry flavor. Prior to my finding this tea, I would sometimes experience rasping sensations following singing my all into certain songs. Now, I drink 2-3 tea bags into a cup (or 3-6 bags into a thermos) of preferably hot water prior to singing, and my throat no longer becomes raspy after enthusiastically belting out my favorite songs. I have gifted fellow karaoke disc jockeys and fellow karaoke singers with this tea, and many have reported back to me the same positive results. So far, my throat seems to really love this tea, and I am a very happy camper !!!
title: YOGI TEA THROAT COMFORT TEA BAGS === A +++++

body: I'm 23 and had a hormonal imbalance where i would  not get my period. My doctor immediately said, well here is some birth control for you. I tried the pills and got sick (nausea/migranes/stomach aches). I wanted something natural, so i decided to do some research online and bumped into this tea. I started getting my period naturally after 3 months of drinking this cup of tea with two tea bags everyday. I guess it depends on the severity of your imbalance, some people say they see a difference within days or weeks. Bottom line is it has worked for me, i am still using it and will continue using it. body: I bought this tea because I love the Aveda calming tea, and several of the reviews said it was very similar.  I was also concerned because several reviews said the mint was way too strong.  The directions say to steep the tea for 5-10 minutes.  If you do that, you will get a VERY strong mint flavor and it is overwhelming (not like the tea from the salon).  I tried it twice, once I left it about 10 minutes and the second I left it at least 5 minutes (possibly more).  So I tried it again but only let it steep for about 3 minutes and it is MUCH better.  The flavor is more mild and the flavors meld together better.  I might even try it a little less (maybe two minutes) as I really like more subtle tea. Obviously you can't beat the price, and if you play around with the times, you will get something similar to the Aveda calming tea for a much better price.
title: If you like the Aveda calming tea, read this review!

body: Do you spend to much time with your loved ones?  Wish you could get away?  I think this is the Tea for you!  Alone time has never been easier, just have a nice warm glass of mint tea wait 2 to 4 hours and BAM mini vacation from life!  and by mini vacation I mean you'll spend an hour crying in the bathroom on the toilet. And really who's going to visit you there?  Pesky kids you say, NOT with the noises coming out of you! guarantee to stay clear. Might even run away from home.

body: I have had anger issues the majority of my life. They only got worse after going to the middle east for the US Army. After my tour I developed an anxiety issue. I battled constantly with it, every day. This tea eliminates all of my anxiety. I am happier, my work is better, people like me waaaaaay more.

body: Even after I read the reviews before i bought this tea I didn't believe that this will help me, its amazing how good this teas are, I def recommended, I have a bad case of PMDD and i could tell the difference within days! Thank God I found this product, it's priceless, no sypmtoms ....yay

body: I was so excited when I saw this tea in bulk online. It's so much for just one box at my local store I had to take this deal and buy online. I love this tea so much. Every time I feel myself getting sick or some kind of upper respiratory problem going on I brew up a cup of this and immediately start sipping. I swear it works after the first one if I catch the cold in time. I'm usually the type of person where hardly anything works for me when I do get sick so I'm glad I found this product. I usually just add a bit of honey in for my throat and it's the best. Even when I'm not sick I like to have at least a cup a day or every other day for my allergies (which are completely terrible this time of year). The shipment came quick and was packaged nicely, considering its just a couple of boxes of tea, but still. Don't hesitate to try this if you are looking for a new tea to try for your immune system.
title: My holy grail tea!!

body: This tea is a great replacement for the capsule form of St. John's Wort.  One cup a day, with two bags and some honey to sweeten, is a great booster.  I definitely notice the difference on those days when I do not get to have that cup!
title: Very calming.

body: "Well this is not the tastiest tea, nor is it the most effective. I would say that diet and eating proper foods works much better than drinking tea made of raspberry leaves, although I am still using it, I hope it is helping." Is what I said after I first bought it. Amazon won't let me change my rating but I was wrong...
title: Humm... I changed my mind

body: I have a rare autoimmune disease that affects my joints and causes major pain in the winter months.  If I drink this tea it relieves the pain so much that I don't have to take nearly half of the dosage of medication that I was taking in the past.  No more prescription pain pills.  Just Aleve every now and again.  I have it on auto ship it works so well.

body: This one is one of the nicest teas I have had. I am from India so have tried a lot of teas and concoctions and this tastes good and makes me feel nice and relaxed.

body: My anger/tension/irritability is off the scale and I have been trying anything and everything to help myself calm down. I have been using the calming and bedtime teas for the past 2 weeks and I have to say that even though I still get quite mad, I do feel that I have been calmer and not as snappish as I was. The flavors are delicious, especially with honey. I also suffer from gastrointestinal issues and it hasn't really helped in that respect, though....but I'm on some Crohn's level issues. I must say that it has helped with the severe tension headaches that work and kid give me daily, especially when trying to go to sleep. It is nice to be able to use a natural product to help myself with my anger management problems instead of loading up on medications.
title: searching for peace

body: I have previously reviewed this same product under another listing at the following link:

body: I wish I would have found this tea sooner.  Throughout my teens and 20s I suffered with crippling cramps that required very unhealthy (and dangerous) amounts of painkillers.  About a year ago I started drinking this tea (one bag every night about a week before my time arrives), and now I can go some months without taking any pain medicine at all.  When I do need pain medicine usually only 200-400mg of ibuprofen does the trick.  I am ecstatic - it really feels like a miracle.
title: Lifesaver

body: I drank this tea both while trying to conceive and in my third trimester in hopes of shortening labor. I enjoyed the taste, though I know not everyone will. Others have recommended making it into iced tea. I drank two cups a day in my last trimester and ended up with a relatively short 9 hour labor (first time mom, nurses and doctors kept commenting on how fast I was progressing). Can I credit the tea? Not sure, but I enjoyed the chance to sit down and relax with a cup of tea.
title: Great for pregnancy

body: I have one of these teas daily to help with depression and anxiety. I am off my medication and these teas help me feel good. I can feel the difference when I don't drink one. I don't like taking medication so I decided to try the natural approach and it has really worked!

I will continue to use this occasionally, and I have already recommended it to several friends. I like the taste and enjoyed having a cup every day.

At 37 weeks I began supplementing this regimen with red raspberry leaf capsules. Never had Braxton Hicks or false labor, healthy baby was born one day shy of 39 weeks. He was my first baby but he came fairly fast (woke up at 1:00 a.m. with contractions, born at 6:17 a.m.). Labor and delivery was not nearly as painful as I expected -- I did it all without inducement or pain meds, and only spent 20 minutes pushing. I credit this tea and weekly aerobic yoga for the ease of my first childbirth experience. Will definitely drink again during future pregnancies!

body: I tried out half a box of the Yogi Soothing Caramel Bedtime Tea, bought because I have a sweet tooth and thought I'd enjoy it better than this version. Although the Caramel version does indeed taste lovely and is a nice way to unwind before bed, I eventually realised that it wasn't helping me sleep. Now this stuff - Yogi Bedtime Tea - has the magic ingredient Valerian which the other doesn't and actually makes a difference to my sleep. I sleep for longer after drinking it and that's a huge deal for this long-time insomniac.
title: It works.

body: I have been drinking a lot of this tea the last couple days since I received it. I feel like it helps with water retention, and my body is flushing a lot out since I have been drinking it. Also noticed some kidney soreness at the same time, as well as a constant need to drink more fluids. I'm not sure if that is due to the tea or something else in my life that has been affecting me, but it seems like this tea really helps with detoxification. IMO it tastes good too. I enjoy it without any sweeteners, and prefer it unsweetened. Also, one bad thing about the processing of the tea bags... The string is not stapled to the top. It's a manufacturing issue. The tea bags are NOT SEALED, and if you move it around too much when seeping, the loose crushed leaves will come out into the tea. The strings are not attached to the bags either. I just place the bags against the tea cup and the moisture allows the bags to cling to the side of the cups. I leave it for 10 mins or so, and then squeeze the liquid from the bags before removing them from the tea. Problem solved. It is still very worth the price and I will be purchasing again. Also, I have not had my period since drinking this tea, so I can't say anything about how the tea addresses the issue of PMS. I have bad PMS at times, with symptoms that include bad cramping and diarrhea, light-headedness, fatigue and low moods. It has been sporadic, with some months symptom free, and very painful during some months. I sure hope this tea helps... otherwise, I don't know what I'm gonna do when I have to work on the days I have PMS...
title: Great Tea

body: love love love this tea!  i must have been drinking this for at least 6 years though my daily use has decreased significantly as have pms symptoms like bloating, mood fluctuations, and feeling crappy overall, as well as cramps and heavy clots during periods. It has a mild flavor, and the taste of the chamomile and parsley do come through pretty strongly but I find that it helps tremendously with nausea as well.

It feels better immediately after drinking. This is not scientific. It could be something else helping my throat. But for now, I'll keep drinking it and see. In winter, the hoarseness and raspiness, congestion, itchiness, need to clear throat gets worse generally, but has improved since lifestyle changes in the last few years.  (I saw an ENT & RESPIRATORY SPECIALIST about this condition.) I was happy to find this tea and glad to have the pack of six. So I'm adding this to my regime. I will be ordering more. I like to combine excellent medical care with common sense, healthy living and natural healing methods.

body: I only drank the tea for one week a few months ago, yet it lightened my periods and they are still much lighter than before. Birthing 3 babies and then emergency contraceptives had made my periods so heavy.  Now they are normal again.

Regular milk would probably be fine too. To taste like chai, it needs some dairy or dairy substitute, so it's a bit more complicated than other teas. For this reason, I wouldn't carry it with me when I travel. But still, it's wonderful to come home to!

body: Tasty

I enjoyed it warm with a splash of milk and honey, or iced with some sugar like sweet tea :) The subscription price makes it a great deal! I recommend this to all my nursing mama friends!

When we have friends & family over I always make this for them and EVERYONE leaves with a box as they fall in love with the flavor!

It has a nice subtle flavor we haven't found in any other similarly marketed tea. If you enjoy hot tea regularly and you're in the market for an evening tea, I would easily recommend this choice.

body: While it may be fine for others, this tea gave me stomach discomfort, seemed to elevate anxiety a bit (probably due to the gastrointestinal discomfort) and, overall, didn't taste good at all. In fact, I had to ADD honey to make it more tolerable.  It may be for you, but it wasn't my cup of tea.
title: Gave me stomach discomfort

body: This teas is perfect to drink eveyday, as well as for pms...and during menstruation. It seems to lesson cramping and irritability.

body: I am actually pretty wary of these natural remedies as a lot of them seem to be ineffective or bogus. But after the first sip of this tea, I swear the room I was in became brighter. The pressure in my head from tremendous stress I am under vanished. This is some miracle tea here.
title: Pressure in my head from stress is gone!!!!

body: My PMS has gradually worsened over the last several years to the point where I really only have one good week a month. I was desperate for something to help control mood swings, breast tenderness, etc. and make me feel normal again or at least not so grouchy. This tea has done it! My breast tenderness is nearly gone and I feel normal, happy, and am a more pleasant wife to my dear husband! We both are very happy with this tea. (I drink 2 cups per day two weeks prior to my period and increase it for the week prior).
title: What a difference!

body: I was having trouble maintaining my milk supply and this tea helps a lot. I now have extra milk for pumping. :)
title: Love this tea!

body: We thought this was a vanilla hazlenut *tea* (with black teas), but it really is a vanilla hazlenut herbal (no actual tea leaves) chai.  That said, it is quite nice, we make a pot with a black tea bag and a vanilla hazelnut tea bag and it is very good.
title: Not what we expected but very nice and grows on you

body: This tea has literally made my LIFE better! I'm 26 years old & I've suffered from endometriosis since day 1 of getting my monthly... so about 13 years now. I've had to miss days from work & school because I'd be in too much pain to even walk standing straight up. Couldn't focus, no appetite, dehydrated, nausea, hot flashes, night sweats, irritability, mood swings, vomiting.... a traumatic experience to look forward to every single month. I even missed my high school graduation because I got "sick" the same day. A family member told me about this tea & so I bought the pack of 6, along with raspberry leaf (started drinking both last month). I drink 2-3 cups a day, beginning a week before I'm expecting my menses. I no longer have to worry about missing out on events or work because this tea knocks out EVERY bit of pain & other symptoms I used to have! I still get night sweats, but I'll take that over excruciating pain!! Every pain medication I've taken can't compare to the herbs that this beautiful earth has to offer! Thank you Yogi!!!!!!
title: Life Saver!!!

body: It is a tasty and effective tea for what it states.  I make up the tea in the morning and let it steep all day, consuming it before heading home.  The knee discomfort is kept at bay with this tea and a few supplements plus exercise.
title: A tea bag a day helpskeep the knee pain away

body: More dong quai would have made things more potent, but a really good blend nonetheless. Really does help balance out hormones causing irregularities. Takes a few days of drinking 2-3 bags a day for effects to happen though. The chamomile inside also helps with better sleep at night. The taste is like a vanilla chai tea without the milk and sugar. If you let it brew long enough though, you can taste sweetness towards the bottom of the tea.
title: but a really good blend nonetheless

body: Very good tea to relieve stomach upset, the feeling of bloating and general digestive unease.
title: very good tea for your stomach.

body: This is great tea, if you want to relax or sleep. I drink it every night as part of my routine prior to bed. I do add a small amount of organic maple syrup to it, which really enhances the flavor profile. Do not drink this in the afternoon, it may make you sleepy.
title: Bedtime Tea!

body: the perfect amount of lemon to temper the ginger and make the tea sweet.
title: the perfect amount of lemon to temper the ginger and make the tea sweet.

body: Yes, yes and yes some more!!! Variety pack for the things the cold make you suffer with. I only wish it cost a lil less so I can try more flavors. They do not disappoint. I always hate when I get to the bottom of the cup. Mm mm good
title: Give me more!!

body: No more pepto bismol! I've been drinking ginger tea almost every night for 2 months except on nights when I need something stronger and this is what I pull out. I will drink this if I've had a heavy meal and I think I might need something stronger than ginger tea. In the past I would have taken pepto bismol but I've been trying to cut down on medications and this is perfect. Now I have unused pepto bismol and prilosec pills in my cabinet.
title: Great for upset tummy

body: This is my favorite ginger tea and I have tried them all! I have slow digestion and this tea really eases the nausea after meals. I am very grateful to be able to buy it in large quantities from Amazon subscribe & save!

body: I really like this tea - the taste just appeals to me.  I have no idea if it helps with mood, but generally drink a cup a day.  The bags are individually sealed to keep it fresh, buying it on Amazon is easy, and I like the package of 6 boxes.

body: I love this tea.  I was skeptical to try it because i hate black licorice.  My husband doesn't drink tea and he really likes the flavor of this.  This is so much cheaper than buying at a grocery store, and i never know if the store will have this flavor.  I will purchase this again.

body: This is my third order of this lovely tea.  Everyone I serve it to wants to know where they can get some.  I served it to my daughter and now even her kids love it (ages five, eight, and eleven).  So I sent some to her, too.  Be sure to get the Licorice Mint and not just the plain Licorice.  The mint gives it an extra dimension.  Even my friends who are hardcore tea drinkers love it.
title: Try it!

body: I started drinking this religiously when I was diagnosed last fall with a large solid ovarian cyst (apple size). The doctors can't pick a diagnosis (dermoid, chocolate, hemorragic, endometriodoma), and I can't afford so many scans/tests without an answer. So I googled, and to give myself a false sense of control, ordered a case of Moon Cycle tea, a kettle, and a case of honey. Taking my ovary in my own hands, if you will.
title: Drinking for Two: My Cyst and I

body: I'm really picky about the chai tea I drink, and Yogi is the perfect cup of tea. I was very pleased to find it here in bulk - Trader Joe's seems to have ceased selling it. Apparently it was "too spicy" (this is what I found out from a friend's husband who works at one of the TJ's warehouses). To me, it's a perfect blend of heady spices, and it's not too overwhelming.
title: The Perfect Chai

body: I love this tea. It helps me with bloat. It tastes ok with sugar. I like the taste but I can imagine it's not everyone's cup of tea.
title: Great for water weight removal

body: I have very serious period cramps problem. I have to take painkillers every time to stop me from kicking pillows and rolling on my bed. SInce I've been taking painkillers for many years, I was looking for a healthier natural solution than chemical painkillers. I found this product, read some reviews and decided to give it a try. Last month, I drank lots of this tea during my period- about 5-6 tea bags a day, and to my surprise, I experienced my first period without pain in many years! It also reduced my tiredness. I don't like the taste too much(I added lots of honey) but I don't care because the effect is satisfying and it's natural! : )  Love this product!!!
title: It works well!

body: Our absolute favorite ginger tea. Spicy, flavorful, long-lasting (I get two or three steeps out of each bag). HIGHLY RECOMMENDED. I have not taken an antacid in over ten years. Ginger tea aids in digestion improve circulation, clears my dry wintery phlegm. I order these tea bags again and again. With this bulk pricing, I never have to make a special run to the store; I always buy from Amazon.
title: Our absolute favorite ginger tea

body: 6 boxes with 16 tea bags in each box - I could not pass up the deal.  The tea itself taste good but as a new tea drinker I did not commit to drinking it everyday otherwise I would have been able experience it better.  So with that, 4 stars for quantity and taste.
title: The tea itself taste good but as a new tea drinker I did not ...

body: This is the most delicious tea!  It has a complex bouquet of flavors and includes enough natural sweetness that no other sweeteners need to be added. My husband, who loves his sugar, was pleasantly surprised that he did not feel a need to add any to this tea. It is warmly satisfying and helps me through the rare days that I am fasting. I find that I can make 2-3 cups of tea from each bag-just need to steep longer if reused, and even after that, it does a nice job of adding a subtle flavor to my ice water.
title: Delicious tea that needs nothing added except hot water!

body: I bought this recently to help with gastritis symptoms. After it arrived and I drank it a few times, I noticed to my surprise that it would actually create mild gastric stress in the form of gas build-up in my stomach and burps. Further investigation revealed that one of the ingredients is "Organic Black Pepper". This is an odd choice for a "Stomach Ease" tea, since people with any kind of acidity problems are supposed to avoid spicy ingredients like Pepper. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone with acidity issues such as gastritis, ulcers, GERD, etc.
title: Contains ingredients that irritate stomach

body: This tea has worked miricles!  For at least 6 years I have had migraines associated with my period. I reacted to the perscription migraine meds.  As the years past, the severity of the headaches increased as well as the duration.  I have taken this tea the last two months and only had a very minor migraine the first month- none the second- which has never happened in years. I drink cup every other day when I'm not on my period, then increase it to 1 to 2 cups a day the week before.  Then the week of my period I drink 2 to 3 cups a day.
title: Good for menstral migraines!

body: It is an excellent alternative of miralax for me. I have severe constipation and it helps a lot.
title: Five Stars

body: I've taken anti-depressants for years and they get so expensive that I gave this stuff a try last year. First used as 'backup', after few months backed off the meds (w/Dr.'s ok) every other day, all the while having 2-3 cups of this each day. (I drink ALOT of tea). Now I'm on subscribe and save and drink this tea, hot or cold, no sugar, regularly. It's got a nice pleasant taste, hot or cold.
title: definately a keeper for me.

body: This was quite helpful in relieving my sore throat and helping me fight a bad cold. However, every single flavor has a VERY strong (and to me, rather off-putting) licorice taste. If you don't love licorice, I'd recommend getting Yogi's Green Tea Trip Echinacea, which does NOT have the same flavor. I wish I had gotten that brand, actually!
title: Helpful but Wretched Taste

body: I drank the “Earth Mama Angel Baby - Organic Third Trimester Tea” brand of for most of my pregnancy. Starting at about 9/10weeks and into the 3rd tri. I switched to this Yogi brand red raspberry leaf tea my third trimester because the Earth Mama Angel was out of stock. I enjoyed the flavor of this Yogi brand one a little better. They both were very tasty iced. Some women say its better with honey but I didn’t mind it plain. My midwife suggested 1 cup per day during the 1st trimester, 2cups 2nd, 3cups 3rd… Both teas are very mild and I found both tasty – they are both an excellent price to buy in bulk.
title: They say this preps you for a speedy labor... I am proof!

body: I've tried other detox tea with a bitter taste and a slightly foul smell. These teas actually taste really good and there is no unpleasant odor. Be prepared to run to the restroom often if you have a cup. A def repurchase.
title: Great taste!

body: I love this tea.Quite honestly, it is the only thing that makes my beautiful monthly gift bearable. I have found that when I drink this tea two weeks before my period at least 2 cups per day the first week and 3-4 cups a day the week before my period that I am (almost) cramp free! I still get some fatigue before my period but my mood is also better. When i dont use this tea I am bedridden at least one day every mont in pain from my cramping. I know its kind of high maintenance to remember to drink the tea and to drink it so often but it sure as hell beats another bad period  I usually only have to take 1-2 midol the first day of my cycle instead of my prescribed medication. Thats saying a lot. Buy this in bulk and keep it on hand if you have painful periods like me, you wont regret it.
title: Great For Painful Periods!

body: I am doing my natural thing and not buying any overcounter medications and I am not on any presc. meds. I know when I use to be on my period I used to take a motrin or midol. I had headaches and bad cramps, the medication did take some pain away but not all you know it just suppress the pain.
title: This tea keeps me from bloating....awesome tea!!!

body: This has really helped with my hormonal acne.  Since I've been drinking two cups everyday, I no longer get acne (at all).  It's definitely a great alternative to birth control pills.  Now the taste isn't that pleasing but I don't mind especially since it has cleared my skin.
title: Great for Hormonal Acne

body: I'm an active woman in my late twenties with no other physical problems apart from severe PMS/PMDD (symptoms including 3-4 day long migraines, fatigue and body pain, skin rashes and emotional upsets). I started drinking 2-3 cups of this tea (single-strength) about a month ago and noticed a HUGE improvement in symptoms- going from that laundry list above to a few hours of fatigue and a headache is enough to make me stick to this in the long term. Just to add, this list doesn't include cramping so I can't say whether it would help with that.. though I imagine it might.
