body: I purchased a case of this tea a while ago and now am finishing up my last box and about to reorder.  This tea is so good I regularly put a few packets in a purse or my backpack so that I can enjoy some when I am not at home. The aroma is heavenly - cinnamony, chocolatey, spicy, beautiful. The flavor is delicate but bold, and this tea is so sweet by itself that I find I do not need to add any sugar or sweetening. I previously drank a lot of milk and would put milk in this tea -- it is very good that way but not necessary.
title: Heavenly taste and beautiful aroma. Warming, sweet, chocolatey, cinnamony

body: I love this tea, it is so yummy and I love that it is organic.  And, it is cheaper than buying Raspberry Leaf tea at the store.  Plus, I can't find Raspberry Leaf anywhere buy health food stores or Whole Foods, so it is nice to get it on Amazon.  I was paying $5 or more for a box of tea.  This tea is supposed to help with female reproduction and toning the uterus, which is why I drink it all day long.

body: This is AMAZING tea! I have found that it greatly reduces my cramps and I am not so miserable once a month. And I love the taste. I have given this to a few female friends and they have also found that it helps them with their discomforts. I definitely recommend trying it. It can't hurt...at worst, you have some yummy tea.

body: I love the taste of these teas!  I really don't like black licorice, so was nervous about ordering them, but it's really a pleasant taste!  Naturally sweet and while my husband has been sick all winter, I did not get sick!  And, the reason I bought the teas was to try to keep my voice this winter.  I teach and lose my voice constantly (especially in dry winter), this tea seems to have done the trick!  Not sick, kept my voice, and it tastes good :)

I like that it's naturally sweet without having to add sugar or artificial sweeteners. I don't like mint tea and never cared for licorice but somehow together they make my favorite tea ever!

body: My favorite tea (Echinacea)!! I order this package once a month because it's cheaper than purchasing them individually.

body: Love this tea.  Sweet and gentle.  I like it extra sweet so I use two teabags per a 12oz cup.  Whenever I'm feeling under the weather, I drink this and feel better.  The price is good if you buy in bulk.
title: Soothing, calming with a hint of sweetness

body: Yogi Tea Throat Comfort Tea is what I consistently tote with me for Karaoke singing. This Yogi tea box talks about this tea supporting the respiratory system and soothing mucous membranes in the trachea, refers to it as a healing formula made with Slippery Elm Bark and Mullein, and talks about the herbs in this tea helping to form a protective slippery coating along the throat's mucous lining which the box says can be especially important for singers and public speakers, and mentions inclusion of Black Cherry Bark for soothing effects and pleasant cherry flavor. Prior to my finding this tea, I would sometimes experience rasping sensations following singing my all into certain songs. Now, I drink 2-3 tea bags into a cup (or 3-6 bags into a thermos) of preferably hot water prior to singing, and my throat no longer becomes raspy after enthusiastically belting out my favorite songs. I have gifted fellow karaoke disc jockeys and fellow karaoke singers with this tea, and many have reported back to me the same positive results. So far, my throat seems to really love this tea, and I am a very happy camper !!!
title: YOGI TEA THROAT COMFORT TEA BAGS === A +++++

body: This tea is great for people with stomach problems and digestive issues. I can't burp and this really helps stomach gas and when food upsets my stomach.
title: Love it

body: I have horrible sleep problems. Can never stay asleep through the whole night, toss and turn, etc...
title: Amazing Stuff

body: I always use throat comfort as a go to when my throat is sore.  Slippery elm has always been known to soothe a rough throat for singers.  I like this tea so much that I keep it stocked in my pantry at all times.  It arrived quickly and no damage to the box.  Pack of 6 boxes should last me throughout the fall season.
title: I like this tea so much that I keep it stocked ...

body: I have struggled with lack of sleep throughout much of my adult life.  By the time I got to sleeping only 2 to 3 hours a night I started to take this thing seriously.  Here's what I know now:
title: A Help for Needed Sleep

body: This tea tastes amazing and helps with my cramps. Since it has fennel and parsley in it, it almost acts as an emmeganogue on me- meaning it will induce cramping and spotting if I drink it a few days before my period. Hoping it will help regulate my hormones.
title: Great product.

body: I don't love the taste of this tea. But I would still drink it for the health benefits that it is supposed to have. When I would brew this I would combine it with another tea, say decaf Earl Gray or something, to mask the flavor (so two tea bags in one cup). That worked. To me, it sort of tasted like weeds on its own.
title: Yes and No

body: I love this tea! I began drinking red raspberry leaf tea to help with hormonal acne. To be honest, I didn't see much a difference in the acne from drinking the tea, but it did help lighten my periods and I like the taste. It reminds me of a mild black tea. I drink it iced during the summer and hot during the winter. If anyone else is looking for an all-natural treatment for hormonal acne, I highly recommend evening primrose oil. That did help clear up the acne along my chin and jawline, although it took about 3 weeks for it to take effect.
title: Tastes pretty good and helps with female issues :)

body: I admit that I was at first skeptical of Yogi Woman's Moon Cycle Herbal Tea, but after drinking it daily for the past month, I am now a believer!  Usually I suffer from moderate to severe menstrual cramps during the first two or three days of my period.  However, this last period was almost pain-free!  I drank one to three cups of double-strength tea every day and experienced only mild cramps on one day.  I will drink this tea from now on!  Oh, and it's delicious.  No sweetener needed! :)
title: Incredible Natural Relief

body: I love the flavor of this tea and for some reason, I just find it relaxing to drink. Purchasing it here at Amazon, for me, it is good buy - as in a couple of local natural food stores I've paid over $5.00 for one box alone.
title: My favorite tea

body: I have a lot of pain issues and have a very hard time getting to sleep, don't want to take drugs to go to sleep and with this tea I don't have to.  It really works, one bag relaxes me enough to drift off to sleep and on those nights I'm having a lot of problems two bags just knocks me out.  It has a lot of really potent herbal extracts that are strong such as Valerian, Skullcap and those two together will really relax you.  Highly recommend.
title: Puts me to sleep, knocks me out!

body: This tea is delicious and does the job. After the sudden loss of my husband in a tragic accident this tea was the only thing that could get me to sleep.

body: I am writing from my husband's account 😀, but I had to leave a review. I will keep it simple. I hadn't had a period in almost a year. I tried chaste tree and other things to get it back. The ingredients of chamomile, ginger and cinnamon bark make it very soothing.  However it does have a slight licorice flavor from the fennel see and anise.  Believe me, it works!

body: Lets just say that I love this tea so much, I got my husband (who drank only coffee), and several family members hooked on to it as well (I drink it with green tea & honey)! It is especially great for colds & cough. I even give it to my 3 year old when she is sick. My husband was initially concerned about giving it to her, but I showed him that it has all natural ingredients...pretty much the same ingredients I'd use to make her a homemade concoction, and I really don't steep it for too long in hers, making it milder (along with honey). I don't believe in using medicines too much, and so I'm always looking out for naturally curable alternatives for any kind of sickness. Needless to say that I get these boxes shipped on a bi-monthly basis.
title: Love Love this tea!

body: When I have trouble winding down, I make myself this tea. It has stevia in it, so once I weaned myself off of needing REALLY SWEET tea, I realized that I don't need to add anything to it. The longer it steeps, the better it tastes. This is what started my love affair with Yogi teas. It's usually about $4.50 a box in the grocery stores (DC area, so your mileage may vary), so the subscribe and save option on here, or even just getting one six pack, is a HUGE savings. Highly recommended.

body: I like this tea. It makes me regular I guess and debloats my tummy and I guess it cleans my liver as well haha. =)

body: Similar to many reviews - I started drinking this tea when I was 35 weeks pregnant. Drank for 2 weeks and the baby came a bit early - yet it was an amazingly easy and fast labor. It took me less than 30 minutes and I was fully dilated. I had to literally held the baby in so that my doctor could rush in to deliver him. LOL. And he was out in 3 pushes. Everyone was amazed how quick and smooth it was. I also had no tear. Like others said, I don't know for sure if it's really this tea, or genetics, or exercise (I did walk like at least 30 minutes a day), or luck or something else...but really, I can only see benefits of drinking this tea. I'll definitely drink again with my 2nd. Good luck everyone.
title: I'd recommend!!!

body: My partner and I drank this stuff all through our PhD programs, and I swear it's the reason I never needed drugs :)  Normally, I'm VERY skeptical about teas and herbs and their claims (and the other Yogi teas that claim to have a calming effect are useless on me), but with this one, the proof is in the pudding.  (Valerian also totally works on me, for sleep.)

The tea is definitely a good tea for easing tension and anxiety - we order them in packs of 6, which lasts us a month or 2.

body: I have the worst cramps every month. By this I mean the kind of cramps that make you want to stay in bed with a heating pad for the rest of the day. But this tea really helps to make them more bearable. I've found that it helps to start drinking the tea a couple of days ahead of time and for extra bad cramps I use two tea bags instead of one. As for the taste I actually like the spicy orange flavor, you can add a dash of cream to help tone down the spicy flavor if needed.

body: I used to drink this daily but was disappointed to find out that Bedtime tea contains St. John's Wort, which may interact with several medications including birth control pills (please google it as I can't link citations here). I choose not to take SJW for other reasons but ladies please be aware of this if you do take BCP. It surprised me that it was in there as I have enjoyed so many Yogi teas without thinking twice about what was buried in the ingredients list, and this taught me to read ingredients carefully, especially in teas I have every day. The taste was nice, as I like Stevia: those who don't probably will find it bitter or licoricey. If you don't mind the Stevia, or the St. John's Wort (it's prudent to check on any interactions and ask your doctor about that first) then this may be the right nighttime tea for you. Two stars for a nice taste, though I didn't notice any sleep help.
title: Contains St. John's Wort

body: I am a fan of Yogi Teas to start.  This tea is just the right combination of mint, herbs and sweetness.  I like mine with a half teaspoon of honey.  I have heard that other mothers religious drank this tea and had easier labors and deliveries.  We'll see if it works for me.

body: I drink this tea every morning mixed with another tea (green). I have trouble throughout the year with sore throats. The doctors say I have acid reflux but I am trying to control it with dietary changes. At least I'm in style, since the president was supposedly diagnosed too. I decided not to take the meds the doctor suggested for a while to see if I could handle it less aggressively for now and without side effects. The tea has helped my throat. It feels better immediately after drinking. This is not scientific. It could be something else helping my throat. But for now, I'll keep drinking it and see. In winter, the hoarseness and raspiness, congestion, itchiness, need to clear throat gets worse generally, but has improved since lifestyle changes in the last few years.  (I saw an ENT & RESPIRATORY SPECIALIST about this condition.) I was happy to find this tea and glad to have the pack of six. So I'm adding this to my regime. I will be ordering more. I like to combine excellent medical care with common sense, healthy living and natural healing methods.
title: Throat tea helps my sore throats possibly caused by acid reflux...

body: Having tried many (all?) other peppermint teas, Yogi's Purely Peppermint is, hands-down, my favorite. No strange after-taste, with a fresh, smooth, not-overpowering peppermint flavor. I order packages of 6 boxes, because this is my go-to iced-tea drink during Phoenix's very hot, very long summers! It's so refreshing and thirst-quenching, I can drink it all day long since it's caffeine-free and made with organic peppermint leaves. Two tea bags make an wonderful quart of iced-tea... add a little Stevia, and you will get rave reviews like I get. Not too strong, not too weak, just right! I should note that I find some teas are better served cold, others hot, and in my opinion, this one is not nearly as good when served hot.
title: The Perfect Summer Iced Tea!

body: This tea is good for pregnancy and the health of women's reproductive system. Besides the health benefits, the tea tastes great. It reminds of aromatic black tea with some freshness from the raspberry fruit. I drink it every day and sometime add milk or half&half, either way it tastes great.

body: I drink one tea bag daily and it works wonders for me. My complexion is clearer and i feel lighter. This tea eliminates bloating for me. Initially I was not a fan of the taste. Also, this is not a laxative but it will make you poop regularly and it will not be pretty. At least that's been my experience. I love it though, I can see how it's releasing the toxins from my body and the change in my appearance and how I feel, and this is from drinking only one cup of tea per day. I highly recommend this tea and have already put on a coworker, my husband and a friend to this tea. A+!

body: A few years ago, my wife was on a new medication that would make her sick all the time.  We were on vacation and she was in our room throwing up all day.  I walked over to the Whole Foods next door to see if I could find anything that might make her feel any better, when I stumbled upon this while just looking around the tea aisle.  I'm not really much of a natural remedies kind of guy and don't worship crystals... but this just seemed to be too much of a coincidence.  I had to try...!  I made her some back at the room and she felt much better in just a few minutes!  Over the following months, I would make her a cup whenever she was feeling badly.  It really worked!

I have NEVER found a true ginger tea like this.  It's awesome!!  It has a sharp bite that you can't find in most other ginger teas.  This is what ginger is supposed to be like and taste like.  It's excellent.  If you only like a hint of ginger in a heavily blended tea -- this is not for you.  But if your like me -  pack on the ginger person --- you must try this tea.
title: What ginger tea is meant to be - crisp, clean - nice bite perfect GINGER tea -

I recommend this tea.
title: Yogi Tea is great

body: When I was six months pregnant I was telling my midwife how I had been having frequent Braxton Hicks contractions since 4 months and that they were annoying me.  She suggested red raspberry leaf tea to ease them.  It did not ease my contractions though I drank a cup a day for the rest of my pregnancy, but on the day I gave birth, I woke up at 8am in early labor, which lasted maybe til 2:30pm.  By 4:30, I decided it was time to go to the birth center, I was 8cm by the time I got there at 5:00, and my son was born by 7:35.  VERY fast for a first labor.  No pain medication or interventions necessary.
title: Probably gave me an awesome first labor

body: Love at first taste!  It's not just ginger!  There is lemongrass, licorice root, peppermint leaf, black pepper, and ginger root, and the combination, does wonders for your digestion/stomach well being.  I combine it with super antioxidant tea by Yogi, at night and my stomach feels great!!
title: Do you stomach and digestion a big favor!

body: The tea is good, however I like the Alvita better, strictly for digestive issues. This tea tastes like it has cinnamon in it and seems to be stronger in the 'black tea' sense, whereas the Alvita Licorice Root is a much smoother and truer licorice root tea. If you like a black tea taste with a slight hint of licorice, then this is the tea for you.
title: Good Tea in a Pinch

body: I love this tea!  It makes me feel relaxed without feeling drugged or zoned out.  I often have trouble falling asleep at night because of all of the worries, to-do lists, and other thoughts running through my mind.  When I drink some of this before bed it helps me have a clear mind to easily fall asleep :)
title: I love this tea

body: This is my favorite bedtime tea. I used to use Sleepytime, then Sleepytime Extra, but this product is better tasting and more effective for making me drowsy. The ingredients also appear to be higher quality. It has a pleasant flavor similar to chamomile but with other herbs added.
title: Good tasting, effective bedtime tea

body: The tea has a pleasant taste and does seem to have a balancing effect.  The price is fantastic.
title: Tastes great.

body: Tea has a good spice blend to it. Small hints of cinnamon and black pepper. It does have a slight laxative effect on, but nothing too strong.
title: Great Tea

body: Ok so i just got the tea today so i am merely reviewing it on my first reaction to it and i will update again after drinking it for a while. maybe after one or 2 boxes are finished up.
title: Initial reaction...

body: We are big fans of what we call Tummy Tea.  It helps ease our daughter's discomfort and relaxes her, so she can go to sleep at night, on days when she suffers from stomach aches whose cause the doctor can't seem to pinpoint.  This was a quick, easy transaction, and we bought (4) 6 box packages.  We use this on an almost daily basis sometimes and this amazon price can't be beat, though not by much, it can't be beat even with sale prices that we've found.  So, if you buy more than $25 worth you get free shipping :)  This tea tastes great too!
title: awesome product, effiecient seller

body: If your looking for a brain boost...look elsewhere.  THought it would help with some mental fatigue I have been feeling.  Drank it as directed.  Nothing.  Doubled up the dose.  Nothing.  Switched back to green tea.  It tastes good.  But I question the medicinal benefits.
title: It tastes good. But I question the medicinal benefits

body: I have a constant rasp in my throat to the point that I loose my ability to speak. This tea is perfect for relief of the rasp and to help me go all day without experience either symptom. I love the flavor and aroma. I have nothing wrong with my throat. This is a genetic condition I inherited from my mother.
title: LOVE YOGI - BEST TEA EVER

body: This tea really works for me.  I drink it nightly, 2 cups if I'm feeling especially stressed out or anxious about something. It does have an interesting flavor...sort of cinnamon, and almost (but not quite) like root beer.  Lol.  It is, perhaps, an acquired taste.
title: and almost (but not quite) like root beer

body: Drink this stuff religiously right before and during that time of the month. I mix it with honey or creamer sometimes. Has a herby grassy type flavor but I dont mind. I haven't really noticed a difference or improvement so far but I think it's been a placebo effect for me when I am cramping...:)
title: Drink before and during cycle

body: I drink one or two bags every day. I even pack a few bags with me whenever I travel! This does give me a kick of energy without any caffeine which is nice. The taste takes some getting used to, but I like it now. I also think that it has evened me out hormonally. I gave some to a friend and she said the same thing. Plus, I love the Yogi quotes on every tea bag. It's like my daily fortune cookie!
title: This does give me a kick of energy without any caffeine which is nice. The taste takes some getting used to

body: This tea is awesome! I drink this herbal tea to help regulate my cycle and alleviate cramps, and it does just that! It also has a wonderful taste, no need to add sugar or cream. I will be drinking this tea for a lifetime!
title: Awesome!!!!!

body: I tried the Green Chai, Black Chai and Roobios Chai teas from Yogi. Of the 3, I prefer the Green Chai. There is nothing wrong with the Rooibos Chai - it is very flavorful, no caffeine, and all organic ingredients. It just my preference (also it has taken me some time to get used to rooibos) I just prefer tea. For those that want to enjoy a good cup of chai tea but are watching their caffeine intake this is a great option.
title: Nice, flavorful tea

body: I have bad arthritis in my knees and have had knee pain for the past year.  I started drinking this tea, along with taking Glucosamine and Turmeric and have noticed a major difference!  If I skip a couple of days by not drinking the tea, I notice that my knees begin to ache again.  For me, this tea really seems to help.  I went in not expecting much, but was very surprised at how good my knees feel.  I really like the taste too.
title: I definitely notice a difference!

body: I love vanilla and I love hazelnut, but both seem to be lacking in this tea. The tea, however, does have a good full-bodied flavor. I think of this more as a spiced tea with cinnamon, ginger, and cloves prevailing. The tea brews up with plenty of flavor and has enough spice to make me want to drink it earlier in the day than as a nighttime relaxer. I think the name "Vanilla Hazelnut" is misleading, however.
title: not much vanilla, but good flavor

body: Excellent tea, I use it before I go to bed, and it is calming but not as strong as the stress relief from yogi. That one is numbing, this one is more of a classic soft warm tea. I love yogi teas, I use several of their flavors, and this one ranks among their best
title: Excellent bedtime tea

body: Bought this tea for the elderberry included not expecting the best taste.  Found that the taste is excellent!  I have changed my choice of evening drink from decaf coffee to this great tasting tea.  Even my wife has started drinking this instead of her morning coffee.
title: Great Tasting Tea!

body: I love all things ginger, so my opinion may be a bit biased. Fresh ginger is a favorite of mine because of the spicy, astringent bite it has. This tea reminds me of that, although the spicy bite is probably due to the black pepper added. I've tried other ginger teas, lemon ginger teas, green ginger teas - they all seem to have a dry/dull ginger flavor, and I always come back to this one. I love this tea with a dash of honey. It's sweet and spicy and gingery goodness.
title: Great, Spicy Ginger Tea

body: I haven't used this product long or consistently enough to evaluate its health benefits, but the taste is really nice. I've tried raw gingko leaf tea before and the taste isn't great, so this blend of herbs is a nice way to mask its flavor. 1 star off though for the use of ascorbic acid (which is unnatural) and because its a bit drying rather than dehydrating (unlike say good quality green tea).
title: Good Tasting Herbal Tea

body: I usually enjoy this flavor coffee but at least the coffee that comes in this flavor actually smells and tastes like it's advertised. When I am to drinking tea, I enjoy many of the other flavors from Yogi. I especially like the Gingko Clarity and Throat Comfort during the day and Bedtime flavor at night. So that's my palate.
title: Not my cup of tea. Packaging says Vanilla Hazelnut. I tastes Cinnamon and Cinnamon.

body: I brew it with hot water, then add milk and honey.  If it gets too sweet, it is almost like candy.  I have tried many different varieties of Chai and this is the best bagged tea for me.  I would recommend you buy a single box at Whole Foods or some other store before you buy 6 boxes here.  You will appreciate the price at Amazon more and not get 'stuck' with tea that isn't to your taste.  Sweet Thai Basil is also good, as is the green tea chai from Yogi.
title: Yummy Chai

body: Really tastes great and I can feel the detox.  The first few days I had a little achy back and some breakouts, which is normal as your body purges toxins.  I enjoy the taste very much, does not need any sweetening for my taste.
title: Good product and taste

body: It does help when your stomach is upset but unfortunately I can't stand the taste, I don't like any kind of licorice taste and this has a lot of it in it. If you do like it then you will be happy with it!
title: It works, but taste is strong and not for everyone

body: My favorite tea. I drink it two to three times a day. It helps reduce the gas that I sometimes get with some foods. It also has an added benefit that they don't advertise. I think the lemongrass in the mixture keeps mosquitoes from biting me. Everyone around me is getting bites, but I don't. I think the mosquitoes don't like the way my skin smells because of the lemongrass in this tea.
title: Best tea for my digestion; added benefit: mosquito repellent

body: Oh my god, this tea was disgusting and wreaked havoc on my stomach. I'm honestly not sure what I thought I was buying, but I didn't know it was one of those teas that make you run to the bathroom every 5 seconds, which is what this is. Even if that's what you're looking for, I still wouldn't advise you to buy this. It tastes so awful.
title: God Awful

body: My mom had gotten me a pack of this tea because she knew I liked tea and she thought this might help me build up a supply for my newborn. I thought that was stupid but I humored her, how could tea help me make more milk? Well, not only does the tea taste good, it really did help make more milk. I went from pumping 2 ounces to 6 to 10 in a matter of a few short weeks. I highly recommend.
title: A sceptic turned believer

body: From what I read, doing a detox for your liver and kidneys are a good thing to do.We are exposed to a lot of chemicals(from cleaning solutions to food additives) that will tax the kidneys and liver.It is a little strong which I got to appreciate after a few cups and now I really like it.Who knows if it is really working, the internet does have some references that this will help.
title: doing a detox for your liver and kidneys are a good thing to do

body: The taste is not so good. But it does help ease the cramps. My cramps are so painful that I will push myself to drink just about anything that will take the pain away. So would I recommend purchasing this product? Yes. Definitely yes. I do suggest purchasing it in store so that you're not forced to buy it in bulk here.
title: Doesn't taste too good, but it works!!

body: I ordered this tea hoping to find a less expensive alternative to Aveda's wonderful licorice peppermint tea. This is exactly that! I'm not usually a licorice fan, but here it acts as a natural sweetener and nicely enhances/balances the flavor of the peppermint. It's the perfect antidote to my sugar cravings and now the tea I drink more often than any other!
title: my favorite tea!

body: This is wonderful tea if your hormones are out of whack like mine.  I love it, the taste is an acquired thing...but if you can get used to that you're golden.

body: A really good tea.  I like using this tea combined with any other because its naturally sweet so you dont need any sweetner.

body: I bought raspberry leaf tea on my doctors recommendation - using it to reduce inflammation. This tea tastes great and helps with the inflammation too. I have tried 2 other brands but the taste was bland. I am please with this purchase

body: excellent product, received on time
title: Five Stars

body: I don't know what it's like to not use this tea as it was my first baby. But seemed to help and tasted great!
title: I don't know what it's like to not use this tea as it was my ...

body: This is a very tasty tea. The tea is sweet enough to my taste that I don't need to add a sweetener. I usually drink it as it without adding anything.  I prefer this brand of licorice tea to many other brands of licorice tea that I have tried. I find that this tea produces a general sense of well being  for a day or two after I drink it.  There really isn't much I can add to other reviews of this tea except to also give it my vote of confidence.

body: Really helps with minor tummy troubles (indigestion), and tastes good. Mild ginger taste - not too strong. Blends really well with the lemon. It's a staple in my home. And really really great when you have a cold.

body: Sometimes my husband has insomnia.  I've been buying this tea for years and he says this tea helps.  I like it because it's a nice "natural" way to help with insomnia.

body: Excellent, Absolutely satisfied with the delivery and merchandise. Thank you!

body: As a yoga teacher I offer Yoga Nidra sessions and Restorative Yoga workshops.  This tea is offered at the end of each of these classes and on occasion in the winter months to the students that come.  They love it!! They say the smell of it takes them right back into bliss.  I have never had anyone say it is too spicy and I don't add milk or stevia.  Give it a try.... you will love it.  Wonderful tea!

body: My husband always prefers to make fresh ginger tea by boiling fresh ginger in water. Yogi Ginger Tea is the next best thing to that and I like to pack a few with us while we travel and take it with me to work.

body: I heard so many great things about this tea I had to try it.  Now I drink it every day! It can be hard to find it at a reasonable price but this is really a great deal!

body: I love this tea. I drank it with my first pregnancy during the third trimester. I drank it iced and would make a pitchers worth and drank it through out the following days. I can't say its the tea for sure, but it was my first pregnancy and I was in labor for 7 hours and only pushed for 20 minutes. All the nurses were shocked with out "easy" it seemed. I'm pregnant again and I am starting to guzzle this down now!
title: Try it iced!

body: Excellent!  I really enjoy ...even LOVE this tea.  I have given away boxes of this and find that people who always use sugar/ sweetener in their tea, do not have to use any with this tea.  It is delicious and naturally sweet.  Although many stores now carry the YOGI brand, none but Amazon carries the Throat Comfort Tea with its exceptional ingredients.  I receive it every other month on the renewal plan from Amazon.
title: Exceptional flavor, good for what ails you.

body: Who knows if it's working, but I like the taste. With winter approaching, it is a great purchase.

body: My FAVORITE licorice-based tea. It's sweet and spicy and truly soothing to both throat and tummy. I usually mix it with other herbal blends, but the licorice flavor always comes through. You won't be disappointed!!

body: Yum. I love Ginger tea. I'm happy it doesn't come with stevia added already. Some teas do, but this one's stevia-free and delightful. It really helps with digestion!

body: LOVE  this tea, it is very hard for me to relax and fall asleep even with medication.  I never used to drink tea but I was desperate after 2 nights of no sleep, my husband bought it and I have not stopped using it yet, love it.
title: LOVE this tea

body: For those who find the tea working too intensely, causing diarrhea and severe cramping... just try a milder dose.  I find my best zone for effectiveness and comfort is 1 minute steeping a tea bag, every other day.
title: Too intense?  Just reduce the dose.

body: Great flavor, love that is is decaf. Great part of my night time routine.

body: Tastes bad to me, like licorice. Honey didn't help much. And I don't think it helped my milk supply increase. I took this tea 3 times a day for 3 days.

body: Delicious tasting tea!!  Very aromatic and I feel like it helps me focus when at work!

body: My favorite tea! I used to buy Trader Joe's Ruby Red Chai, but they discontinued it. I found this at Sprout's Farmer's Market, but buying by the case at Amazon is a better value, and means I won't run out!
title: My favorite Chai rooibos.

body: I drink this tea when I feel "foggy headed" I feel better (clear) within 24 hours.
title: ... this tea when I feel "foggy headed" I feel better (clear) within 24 hours

body: I bought this tea after Google'ing remedies for easing menstrual cramps.  I have had painful periods since I was 11 years old and I am now 24.  I began drinking this tea 2 days before my period was expected, drinking about 3 cups/day.  The taste is different, but you get used to it.
title: Cramps Eased

body: Love the flavor of this tea; very happy with the ingredients. Makes consuming more liquid much easier than just drinking straight water.

body: Favorite licorice tea, hands down.  I know eating/drinking too much licorice can increase your blood pressure, but whatever, it's worth the risk.  Anyway, my blood pressure is normal, and I've been drinking this tea for at least 5 years.

body: I can't say enough good things about this tea. Ive been drinking this for a couple years now and it always makes me feel good at the end of the day and waking up. I make sure to always have this in stock in my kitchen!
title: the best!!

body: The name of this tea has changed many times over the years.  A friend introduced me to Yogi and this tea many years ago to help with many of the women's issues associated with our menstrual cycle. I feel like it does help significantly. I still do have severe bloating, but I feel like this helps keep my hormones in check a little better.
title: One of my favorite teas by Yogi

body: I give this stuff out at work so much that I never seem to have any for myself.  It has a sweet, pleasant taste and makes sore throats feel so much better. If you look at the ingredients, you'll see that it contains licorice. I hate licorice, but I can't taste it at all in this tea.
title: Always running out...

body: I have horrible sleep problems. Can never stay asleep through the whole night, toss and turn, etc...
title: Amazing Stuff

body: I am a big fan of Yogi tea. They make great stuff. Always very high quality ingredients, very tasty blends. This is one of the 5-star varieties. Although it lists itself as chamomile and lavender, the flavor is predominantly a nice licorice, which combined with the other ingredients, is more like anise. It is also a moderately sweet tea. I'd call this a 'rich and full-bodied' herbal tea. And, although I'm not a big "traditional remedy" person, there do seem to be some real benefits to this and Relaxed Mind. However, it might be as much due to the enjoyment of a nice hot, flavorful cup of tea, as it is due to the herbs in the tea.
title: GREAT tea!

body: Yogi brand Ginger tea has the spice and zip of a true and flavorful ginger tea. It has a sharp pepper kick that I love. No weakness with this tea. I trusted the reviews on this tea and they were accurate. I've mixed the Yogi Peppermint and Ginger together and they go great together.
title: Pep it up!

body: I am so glad my market had this on sale and I tried it.  And, I love that I can order 6 boxes at once.  It is naturally sweet, so no sweeteners are needed at all and the flavor is wonderful.  For me, this is the best gift that anyone can buy me.  I just wish my local market could carry the Egyptian Licorice with Mint so that I could taste it before jumping onto Amazon and ordering 6 boxes.  I will keep looking.  For another recommendation though (especially for those of us who like our caffeine), try the Yogi green tea with blueberry (they call it "Slim Life", but I bought it for the caffeine and blueberry).
title: So nice to curl up with

body: Lovely red hue, spicy flavor, great price, via Amazon's subscribe and save. It's a real pick-me-up kind of tea and tastes lovely iced as well with a splash of organic agave nectar. Amazon's price is cheaper than my local grocers too. If you like Chai, check this out.
title: Excellent Organic Red Chai

body: 5 stars for the best tea out there!  My family and I have been drinking Yogi tea for years now and loving all the flavors. The throat comfort is my daughter's favorite as she is a singer/performer and this is particularly good tea to soothe her throat.
title: Five Stars

body: The taste is a lovely, sweet licorice, with just a touch of cinnamon (I think I taste anise, too). Relaxing to breathe in and very smooth to sip. Just be ready to go to bed soon afterwards... it really does do the trick!
title: Can't Sleep? Drink This.

body: I drink this tea regularly to help with allergies.  It has been one of the few natural remedies that works really well for me.
title: Great for allergies

body: Nice product, but Extremely displeased that no where on the website does it reveal that this product has caffeine (5 mg).  I am very sensitive to caffeine and I would think the manufacturer would want it revealed that product has caffeine.  Am I missing something?  After 2 cups, I read the label and, after assuming it had no caffeine because it was not revealed on the purchase page, I read the ingredients and see that there is caffeine.  It's like selling a diet product that has sugar.  I purchased a 'pack of 6' and I am having trouble giving the tea away.  I will have to throw it in the trash.  I am extremely disappointed.
title: Mislabeled ingredients

body: This has a wonderful Peppermint taste, much better than others I've tried. It's my favorite tea. I drink it almost every day. Sometimes I even break up and add a hershey's kiss to the mug for an interesting twist :-)  Price is great here at Amazon, much better than at the local Health Food Store. Thanks Amazon !!!!!

body: I usually get a dry cough after a long flight. Sometimes I can't talk for days after my travel so this time I tried this tea and it really helped me recover faster. It also tastes good as it has a slight sweetness to it. So I highly recommend it !  My dad tried it too and he liked it :)

body: This tea both tastes delicious and smells amazing. The blend of spices has a rich, complex flavor that never gets bitter even after leaving the tea bag in my mug the entire time I'm drinking the tea. I don't even like licorice but this tea doesn't taste like licorice candy; it's much more nuanced and balanced with other spices. The best part is that it has a hint of sweetness so no additional sugar or sweetener is needed.

body: I tried out half a box of the Yogi Soothing Caramel Bedtime Tea, bought because I have a sweet tooth and thought I'd enjoy it better than this version. Although the Caramel version does indeed taste lovely and is a nice way to unwind before bed, I eventually realised that it wasn't helping me sleep. Now this stuff - Yogi Bedtime Tea - has the magic ingredient Valerian which the other doesn't and actually makes a difference to my sleep. body: I read reviews online that this tea can help labor and delivery go faster and make it less painful. I started drinking the tea twice a day at 37 weeks pregnant. I went into labor naturally 10 days later at 39 weeks. My contractions were not bad at all, even when they were coming every 2-3 minutes apart. Although I did get an epidural when I was at 3cm just because I didn't want to feel any pain at all. I think the epidural might have slowed down my labor, it was 14hrs from start to finish and it was my 3rd baby. I think the tea helped make my contractions less painful compared to my last labor with my 2nd child. My second child's labor was 8hrs but that was 14 years ago too.
title: Helped my contractions to be less painful

body: I drank this tea on a few occasions, and it truly does produce a calming effect.  It has a strong licorice flavor, which I dislike, but if you can get past the strong aroma, this may be a tea that you want regularly.  I don't recommend drinking it double strength (made with two tea bags) the first time you try it.  One bag will work for most people.  I tried it with two bags after I had been drinking it for a while, and I found it to be overpowering for me, and it knocked me out cold for a couple of hours.  I had to allow some time for it to wear off, and I didn't feel alert and steady for a while.  Yogi is a brand that I can highly recommend.

I think I've had more success with lactation cookies versus tea, but I also don't drink 3 cups/day as the packaging recommends. Definitely worth trying!

There are sayings on each of the tea tabs, which are kind of like fortune cookie fortunes. Sometimes they are nice, but most of the time they are kind of condescending. I do like that each bag is individually wrapped, so it doesn't collect dust or dirt if I get sidetracked before I can make my tea.

body: I drink one tea bag daily and it works wonders for me. My complexion is clearer and i feel lighter. This tea eliminates bloating for me. Initially I was not a fan of the taste. It's spicy in a pumpkin spice cinnamon type of way, which I'm not a fan of, but after drinking it a few more times I don't mind the taste at all anymore. Also, this is not a laxative but it will make you poop regularly and it will not be pretty. At least that's been my experience. I love it though, I can see how it's releasing the toxins from my body and the change in my appearance and how I feel, and this is from drinking only one cup of tea per day. I highly recommend this tea and have already put on a coworker, my husband and a friend to this tea. A+!

body: I'm a chiropractor specializing in fertility, pre-natal, and pediatric care.  I always have this tea here in the office because of it's healing and soothing effect on the female reproductive system.  I recommend it for menstrual cramps, any cycle irregularity, during pregnancy, and general uterine health.  It's a miraculous ancient remedy used by native cultures for centuries.  I've always loved the quality of Yogi Teas and their Red Raspberry Leaf is delicious.  For those who haven't tried it, it's like a mild black tea in flavor and naturally a little sweet. Try drinking it throughout your next period and see how soothing it is for yourself. I usually drink a cup every day and maybe two during my period. Enjoy!  Colleen [...]

body: I didn't think I would like this tea because I am not a big fan of licorice, but it has a surprisingly pleasant taste and I can almost drink it without adding a sweetener. I do drink it with a bit of raw honey added, though, because I prefer the taste. I bought this tea because I was hoping it would help with some upper respiratory issues I was having. I am not one to take medication unless I absolutely have to.  It did not seem to help much for the first couple of days, but I only drank 2 cups each day. After I had been drinking it for a couple of days it did seem to help me breathe a bit better and calm my coughing fits. Nothing else I had tried helped at all. I am now happy to say that the respiratory issues I was having are subsiding and I believe I owe it in part to this tea.
title: Seems to help with upper respiratory issues

body: I use a combination of methods to increase my supply. I am still not pumping enough for all of my baby's feedings, but that is probably an individual problem. I drink one cup (doesn't taste good enough to have more) of the Mother's Milk Tea before bed, 2 Fenugreek in the morning and 2 at night, oatmeal for breakfast, a Gatorade/Powerade with lunch, and of course lots and lots of water. It may seem like a lot, but I am doing my best to make sure my baby has at least some breast milk as long as I can produce it.

body: I enjoy other dessert teas (Harney & Sons, etc.), but this flavor is wonderful. body: Drank 4 cups a day beginning at 28 weeks of pregnancy up until the day of delivery. Sometimes drank it iced and sometimes hot. Drank a hot large cup on the way to the hospital that was steaped for a good 20 mins.  It was my first pregnancy and had a rather easy delivery and dilated from a 4 to a 10 in about a 1/2 hour. Also, I didn't have any painful contractions after delivery during breastfeeding. Not sure if I can credit the tea but it sure doesn't hurt to try!! I will be drinking this tea with my future pregnancies as well. Enjoy!

body: As any woman going through monthly cramps knows, the pain and irritability turn you into a crazed werewolf. That's why this tea is so appropriately named. I still have to take heavy duty pain killers, but this new addition soothes the edginess and constant growling :)

body: I first had this tea at least 6-7 years ago; it was in my friend's mom's tea collection. I was intrigued by the name and the old box--the packaging looked way cooler back then. Well, I had one cup, and then another--maybe even three while we were hanging out. I liked it a lot, obviously, but I forgot about it until a few months ago when I started getting into drinking tea instead of coffee--it just popped into my head--"hey, THAT was some REALLY good tea!"  Luckily I remembered the name and was happy to find it and ordered a 6-pack. I was even more delighted to find that it was sweet enough without any sugar or stevia or anything, thanks to the licorice--and I have a sweet tooth.  It as a nice, full flavor--certainly not just that of licorice, which sort of hits your palate as the last note. The other herbs, spices and orange flavor complement it beautifully. Highly recommended, by someone who (like most people) HATES black jelly beans--those are a poor excuse for a representation of what licorice should taste like. Enjoy this instead.
title: Tasty without sugar

I'm prone to sinus infections just because of my allergies so this stuff is great.  Some of my friends comment that the taste is not that great, bt I really enjoy it.  It's a very earthy tea and has a strong ginger flavor.

body: I'll go ahead and say that this is my favorite tea to drink. I've always wanted to try Echinacea tea, so I decided to try a couple different brands to see which one I liked the best. I bought this brand and the Traditional Medicinals brand. What I like best about Echinacea tea is the tingly, yet lightly aromatic, sensation it creates when you drink it. Yogi has a more prominent taste and sensation to it compared to the other brand.

The only drawback that I have seen about it, is that it seems to leave my throat a little dry for singing compared to a licorice flavor that seems to coat my throat.  If you mix a bag of this chai with the Yogi Egyptian Licorice, what a great combination!

body: The ginger in this blend is very noticeable, I LOVE it! Made with two spoons of raw honey and some fresh skim milk, it's refreshing and soothes away headaches and nausea. If you double bag for stronger chai like I do, the pepper really comes out if you leave them in for too long, but it's still quite pleasant!

body: Tea isn't necessarily something that I go around raving about to people but it's funny how many people I've recommended this to or to whom I given a box. It's just so good, needs no sweetening and great for post-meal or for calming at the end of a day. I like to try new flavors but I keep coming back to this one as a perfect stand-by.

body: I can't drink caffeine after 2 pm, so I drink this Vanilla Hazelnut. Good tasting and has enough flavor to hold up to adding milk to it. Very reputable brand and consistent flavor. Also individually packaged tea bags, so I can carry one in my purse for eating out -- just ask for hot water.
title: Afternoon tea

body: The best tip I have been giving related to menstrual issues is to take this tea.  It tastes great.  I have a warm cup of this tea in the morning everyday the week before my period.  I often pour the rest from the pot into a glass to refrigerate and have a tasty cool treat in the afternoon.  It has significantly reduced my cramping, flow and general blah feelings that come with my period.  I love the yogi tea bag tags that have little quotes with positive thoughts for the day.

body: Yes it's Chai Tea but I'm not as crazy about it as many of the other posters.  To me it lacks the spice everyone else that gave it 5 stars claims it has.  I'll drink it, but when it is gone I'll try something else. I wouldn't tell anyone not to purchase this but I wouldn't recommend it to anyone either.  That is why I give it 3 stars as I believe it is an average Chai Tea at best.
title: It's Chai Tea

body: I get a chest cold every winter which settles in my lungs and causes me to cough for months without relief. My doctor says it is normal and there is little I can do to prevent it. Well, Yogi Cold Season tea helps a lot! I have been drinking a cup a day of this outstanding tea since Thanksgiving and so far, knock on wood, I have not had my usual chest congestion. Other reviewers testify to this fact - it works. If you get chest congestion, give it a try. By the way, ignore those who say the taste is awful. Not true. No, it is not delicious, but it certainly is acceptable.
title: Just plain works!

body: I brought a pack of 6, I gave one to some of my nursing classmates, knowing how much stress we are under. We were pleasantly surprised to see how relaxed and rested we felt when we woke up. Don't get me wrong, it doesn't make you sleepy. Nonetheless, once you sleep, you wake up the next day you don't feel tired.
title: Tastes good and smells good.

body: I suffer from migraines and decided it was because of my bad eating habits over many years.  Eating more real foods and raw foods made me feel good, so I decided to speed the process by doing some "lite" detox by drinking this tea.  I figured this is mild (it's just a tea) so I probably drank several cups the first day and at least 2 a day after that.  I had some headaches that weren't the same or as bad as my usual migraines, but the first round was still debilitating.  I recall thinking maybe I should cut back to just one detox tea a day, so did.  10 days later I got another headache like the one before but slightly milder -- better than a migraine, but still very unpleasant, but no vomiting this time.  Then I started having continuous headaches every day and night, and couldn't figure out why since I was eating much healthier and had even lost a few pounds.  I felt awful all the time and was getting really depressed that it wasn't going away and I didn't know what to do to get better -- I was doing all the right things!  I racked my brains and recalled earlier linking headaches to too much detox tea, so I stopped drinking it altogether -- headaches gone in 2 days off the tea.
title: Not good for some of us -- be aware of your body's reactions during the first week of use.

body: I don't use a lot of this, but I find that a couple of sips after a meal helps with digestion.  It has also been very helpful with occasional bouts of abdominal pain.  It might be too sweet for some people, but is fine for my taste.
title: Gentle Medicine

body: Ginger is definitely good for your stomach and I have searched many products in order to find a ginger tea that tastes good.  Yogi Ginger Tea is definitely my choice and I drink it every day.  It is fairly mild in flavor so you can let it steep longer than you normally would with other teas.  I like a little honey in mine but can also enjoy it plain.  I have a standing order for this tea and can  recommend it to anyone who enjoys the flavor of ginger.

body: I've been nursing now for almost five months and I drink 2-5 cups of this tea every day.  It tastes great, helps me stay hydrated, and helped me ramp up my production on the side that was lacking.  I buy this tea for all my new-mommy friends as a "welcome to motherhood" gift.

body: This is the tastiest herbal tea I have ever had! It has a slight minty-cool flavor to me, but also a warming effect. It's a very complex flavor. I highly recommend this tea. Amazon shipped my tea with an expiration of July 2012, which I greatly appreciate.

body: I have a very difficult time falling asleep unaided, and I've tried it all.  This tea is the best bedtime tea I've ever had; it tastes lovely (albeit a bit minty, but I don't mind that at all.)  Most importantly, my brain begins to slow down and its time to rest.  My subscribe and save routine ended, which put me in a panic that Yogi was gong to stop making it.  Here, they've only improved the price!  I don't review a lot of products, but this one is a keeper.  And the price on Amazon is among the most lovely of all!
title: Lovely- its both tasty and relaxing

body: One mug of Yogi lemon ginger tea -- brewed double-strength -- has become a morning ritual for me.  I pause for a moment to read the inspiring proverbs attached to the string on each tea bag...  And then again as I sip through the spicy brew, contemplating the day ahead (and maybe the world at large!).  All joking aside, this is the BEST ginger-based herbal tea I have come upon.  Yogi tweaked their mixture until they got it RIGHT.  Enough said...  But just one more thing -- the subscribe-and-save option is a blessing.  No more worries about finding the tea in-store.  Thanks, Amazon!
title: A DAILY Pastime!

body: Actually I ordered this tea for my Mom - who loves it and drinks it all the time. She could not find it in her local stores, so I checked Amazon. Not only did we find the tea, but it was significantly less than she was paying for it - when she could find it. She was overjoyed! So thank you for providing a great value, shipping it quickly, and providing a way for show some love to my Mom! :-)

It's the perfect antidote to my sugar cravings and now the tea I drink more often than any other!

body: This blend of kava and other spices is delicious and very convenient. When prepared this way I have found a single bag has the effect that is usually associated with kava (as opposed to the two bags many reviewers have recommended to achieve this effect).

body: i started drinking this tea last year after i came off the pill. i was hopeful that it would help my cycles normalize after being on hormones for 15 years and to my surprise, it did. right off the bat i had a 32 day cycle with light periods lasting about 3 days max. i wasn't expecting the lighter periods, but it was a welcome surprise! it did make me confusing when i was charting though, i wasn't sure if i was spotting or having a normal period...it didn't take me long to figure it out though. i enjoy the taste, it's nice and light and not too strong. this is definitely the best tasting brand on the market (in my opinion). after giving birth last month i bought more of this tea (i didn't drink it during my pregnancy) and even though i'm still waiting for my period to return (it's been 6 weeks) i'm sure it will soon and i'm confident i'll be as regular as i was before thanks to this tea.
title: tastes great and works wonders!

body: This is my favorite tea ever. It's got a bite from the ginger with a sweet undertaste. I use liquid Stevia in it, so no carbs or calories, but adds the sweetness to cut the bite a bit. Very refreshing hot or cold.

body: Yogi Tea's Woman's Moon Cycle tea could be a lifesaver for you, as it has for so many reviewers here. Personally, I don't like the flavor very much, and for me I find that it doesn't mitigate my symptoms much, either. Your Mileage May Vary, naturally. For a long time I was having a cup every morning, thinking of it as a daily tune-up; maybe I built up a tolerance...? I ran out of the Woman's Moon Cycle and started relying just on the Yogi's Ginseng tea, which includes Dong Quai but not the raspberry leaf that is supposed to be such a help for women (I have a horse-owning friend who says it works on mares, too!!), and I haven't noticed much difference in how I feel.

body: As a yoga teacher I offer Yoga Nidra sessions and Restorative Yoga workshops.  This tea is offered at the end of each of these classes and on occasion in the winter months to the students that come.  They love it!! They say the smell of it takes them right back into bliss.  I have never had anyone say it is too spicy and I don't add milk or stevia.  Give it a try.... you will love it.  Wonderful tea!

And when I do take it, I try to drink 3 cups of this stuff a day. Gross.

It is a delicious addition to my health regimen. I also like that this Yogi tea is organic, since I try to buy organic whenever I can. Try it for the taste, you'll love it for the health benefits.

body: This is many boxes of tea for different ailments. I love them all. The "flavors" and equal number (I think) of the following: Breath Deep, Throat Comfort, Echinaeca Immune Support, Cold Season. I use them all at different times. They get me through.
title: Prep for cold season

body: When I have trouble winding down, I make myself this tea. It has stevia in it, so once I weaned myself off of needing REALLY SWEET tea, I realized that I don't need to add anything to it. The longer it steeps, the better it tastes. This is what started my love affair with Yogi teas. It's usually about $4.50 a box in the grocery stores (DC area, so your mileage may vary), so the subscribe and save option on here, or even just getting one six pack, is a HUGE savings. Highly recommended.
title: Tastes great and does what it's supposed to

body: It's my go-to drink whenever I have a respiratory infection or upset stomach. As close to a homemade pot of fresh ginger tea as you can squeeze into a convenient and portable form.
title: Never without it

body: I give this stuff out at work so much that I never seem to have any for myself.  It has a sweet, pleasant taste and makes sore throats feel so much better. If you look at the ingredients, you'll see that it contains licorice. I hate licorice, but I can't taste it at all in this tea.
title: Always running out...

body: I bought this tea to increase my milk production after I noticed it was decreasing. I pump at work and could no longer replace the supply that my baby drinks during the day. After using this for about a week, I have noticed that I am back up to prior levels, and maybe am producing even more. However, I also did other things to help increase my production, so I can't say with 100% certainty that the tea is the reason. If nothing else, by drinking 3-4 cups a day, I increased my fluid intake, and my milk production increased. The other things I tried at the same time were: sleep as much as possible, nurse or pump at least every two hours, eat better, and try not to stress about not having enough milk.
title: I think it works

body: I first had this tea at least 6-7 years ago; it was in my friend's mom's tea collection. I was intrigued by the name and the old box--the packaging looked way cooler back then. Well, I had one cup, and then another--maybe even three while we were hanging out. I liked it a lot, obviously, but I forgot about it until a few months ago when I started getting into drinking tea instead of coffee--it just popped into my head--"hey, THAT was some REALLY good tea!"  Luckily I remembered the name and was happy to find it and ordered a 6-pack. I was even more delighted to find that it was sweet enough without any sugar or stevia or anything, thanks to the licorice--and I have a sweet tooth.  It as a nice, full flavor--certainly not just that of licorice, which sort of hits your palate as the last note. The other herbs, spices and orange flavor complement it beautifully. Highly recommended, by someone who (like most people) HATES black jelly beans--those are a poor excuse for a representation of what licorice should taste like. Enjoy this instead.
title: Tasty without sugar

body: well, here i am again in my 3rd trimester...and i did some research on the benefits of drinking raspberry leaf tea during this time...and apparently for women it's good to drink just in general, pregnate or not.  so, being a yogi tea lover i ordered a box.  i find it very convinient to be able to buy a 6 pack (16 bags per box) at this price b/c it averages out to about 2 dollars less than you pay per box at whole foods or other grocery stores.  also, i dont worry about running out in a week.  i like to double up the tea bags, i drink about 4 cups per day.  it tastes great in my opinion, and today i just added a fresh lemon from my lemon tree!  delicious!!  as far as the benefits for my uterous i cant really comment on since i'm not a obgyn, and i havent had my baby yet so i dont know if this tea will play any part in easing my labor.  but i can tell you that i love this tea, it tastes great, it makes me feel like i'm doing something good for my body & it's a great price.  i will continue to drink it after giving birth b/c from what i've read there are also post partum benefits of drinking raspberry leaf tea.

body: I was diagnosed (via ultrasound) with adenomyosis.  Of course, the typical course of treatment is birth control pills, a hormone giving IUD, or surgery ...up to and including a hysterectomy.  None of these standard courses of treatment sounded good to me, but I tried the BCPs, for 2 months.  It was probably the best pill I've been on, but I had migraines, ocular and aura, along with minor headaches as well. These continued for about 2 weeks after I discontinued the pill.  I began drinking the tea at least 2 cups per day.  I am very familiar with the ovulation signs of my body.  Within 2-3 weeks of starting the tea, ovulation occurred and 2 weeks later my period started. I am going to buy stock in this...if it goes off the market before I hit menopause, I may lose it!  I will update my review if anything changes in future cycles.
title: relieved symptoms of adenomyosis, PMS, regulated my cycle.

body: This stuff is a sanity saver. One tea bag is enough to bring a wound up day down a notch or three, but doesn't make it impossible to get things done still since there isn't a haze or difficulty concentrating, partially because this is a fairly mild kava dose. I love that this is such an innocuous and convenient way to bring a little calm with me (or make when I have stressful visitors). The tea bags come in individual packets, and I noticed that there was some powder from the tea bag left behind in many of them. One lick of the powder and it was unmistakably heavy in kava, so make sure to get all of it either in the cup or brave the awful taste and just lick the wrapper clean for the best effect! A bit of honey or agave nectar does a nice job of helping the flavor of this tea out, and a little milk makes it almost pleasant.

body: I love this tea...  I will admit, I am a hot and cold tea drinker...  I think for people who don't like tea, probably won't enjoy this.  Taste wise, t tastes to me like a chamomile and peppermint mixed...  I drink a cup of sleepy time vanilla every nite.  When I became pregnant, I wanted to get this tea, and at 5 months along I finally got some.  I LOVE IT!  I usually drink it in the morning and at night...  Sometimes in the middle.  I live in Hawaii where it is. To.  But I also pour over ice too.  I add honey to mine.  I add honey to my sleepy time.  I don't drink sleepy time any more since I got this.  I ha e drank a box already.  I think the trick is steeping the bag long enough.  At least 10 min I leave mine in.  I do use more water then 8oz.  I have a Keurig and I use the highest setting.  It almost fills a grande Starbucks cup...  I suggest this tea for sure to people who LIKE TEA!!! I plan to buy the more milk tea in a few months before I go into the hospital and plan to drink it while in recovery and staying in the hospital...

body: I LOVE this tea! As an avid tea drinker, I wanted to try Yogi Kava Stress Relief to help curb my everyday anxiety. I have been on medication for anxiety in the past (from age 16 to 30) and at 31,  the nerves started creeping up on me again. I was having trouble sleeping, getting dizzy at work and while driving. I was hoping that, as some of the reviews on here have stated, this tea would help me relax without having to turn to medications again. I had some before bed last night and fell into a deep, wonderful sleep. I had a cup this morning at the office and while at first it made my head a little foggy (won't steep my tea that strong anymore at work), that effect wore off and I was able to go out for lunch on my own! (which I have been fearful of as of late. It induced anxiety) I have a clear head today and couldn't feel better. Hopefully this continues as I incorporate Yogi Kava Stress Relief Tea into my daily lifestyle. The taste is also a little odd, kinda like a spicy chocolate. It is something to get used to. I would reccomend to give it a try before buying a pack of 6 boxes ;) Good luck!

body: After getting off the pill (used for 10 years), I started getting very short periods with painful cramps and migraines plus terrible hormonal cystic breakouts 10 days before the period starts. Just one cup two days before my period immediately cured the headache and the cramps. I'm not sure about it's effect on the breakouts yet but I'll keep drinking it a cup everyday. The tea makes me sleepy if I drink it at night and gives me a boost if I drink it during the day. It's odd. I don't understand why people think this tea tastes bad. It has cinnamon, ginger, orange peel, stevia in it and these are pretty much what I taste in this tea. It tastes yummy. I recommend this for all women who have hormonal imbalance. This and castor oil seem to be the only things that have helped me so far.
title: Excellent tea for hormonal imbalance-related issues

body: I am an avid stevia user, however this tea has a very distinct and bothersome taste. I won't call it an "aftertaste" because it's the first thing that hits you when you take a sip. The stevia is so pronounced, that I can't even comment on the overall taste. My 14 yo son (who is also a stevia user) doesn't like it because of the stevia taste. He commented on it the first time he tried it and I hadn't even said anything to him. On the positive side, I have been sleeping well since I started using this tea. I'm on my second of six boxes that I bought from Amazon, I want to like this tea, because it seems to be effective, but will keep looking for an alternative unless they cut back on the amount of stevia. I also ordered six boxes of the Yogi Skin-Detox tea at the same time and it's wonderful and effective. It also contains stevia, but doesn't have the "aftertaste" at all.

body: I saw the rave reviews for this tea, and I decided to do an experiment and try this tea along with the Traditional Medicinals St. John's Wort Good Mood tea. They should have been similar, although it looks like the Yogi tea has more St. John's Wort in it. I've had several cups of both now, and without a doubt the Yogi tea tastes way too licoricey and like it has a fake sweetener in it. The Traditional Medicinals tastes WAY better to me, with a more subtle licorice flavor and no weird fake sweetener taste. Also, it makes me feel better than the Yogi tea. It gives me a little boost, which I'm not feeling with Yogi. Sorry, but I tried it a few times to make sure! If anyone else wants to try the same experiment, I'd be interested in your opinion as well!!!

body: I have been drinking this tea for quite awhile now, half a year maybe. I noticed almost right away that my menstrual cramps didn't hurt so bad! Wow, I could hardly believe I found a natural route to pain relief, a pain I know I will have every month for years to come. So yes, it works for me! Not only does it help with pain, but my period only lasts about 3-4 days rather than 5-6 and it is lighter. I guess you can't believe it until you try it. When I feel my period is coming up, I start drinking a tea in the evening, and then during my period, I drink 2-3 cups. I personally like the taste. It is very simple and nothing frilly. An added bonus is that this tea is calming. After I drink this, I feel content.

body: I bought this tea to increase my milk production after I noticed it was decreasing. I pump at work and could no longer replace the supply that my baby drinks during the day. After using this for about a week, I have noticed that I am back up to prior levels, and maybe am producing even more. However, I also did other things to help increase my production, so I can't say with 100% certainty that the tea is the reason. If nothing else, by drinking 3-4 cups a day, I increased my fluid intake, and my milk production increased. The other things I tried at the same time were: sleep as much as possible, nurse or pump at least every two hours, eat better, and try not to stress about not having enough milk.

I had a great deal of trouble with milk production from the beginning... and have been drinking this tea for months (I am now in my 10th month of breastfeeding).  For that reason, I love that you can order this in bulk and have the option to subscribe and save.  I have a large box delivered with my diaper subscription delivery.  It is so convenient and you can even customize the frequency of delivery! body: I was diagnosed (via ultrasound) with adenomyosis.  Of course, the typical course of treatment is birth control pills, a hormone giving IUD, or surgery ...up to and including a hysterectomy.  None of these standard courses of treatment sounded good to me, but I tried the BCPs, for 2 months.  It was probably the best pill I've been on, but I had migraines, ocular and aura, along with minor headaches as well. These continued for about 2 weeks after I discontinued the pill.  I began drinking the tea at least 2 cups per day.  I am very familiar with the ovulation signs of my body.  Within 2-3 weeks of starting the tea, ovulation occurred and 2 weeks later my period started. I am going to buy stock in this...if it goes off the market before I hit menopause, I may lose it!  I will update my review if anything changes in future cycles.
title: relieved symptoms of adenomyosis, PMS, regulated my cycle.

body: This stuff is a sanity saver. One tea bag is enough to bring a wound up day down a notch or three, but doesn't make it impossible to get things done still since there isn't a haze or difficulty concentrating, partially because this is a fairly mild kava dose. I love that this is such an innocuous and convenient way to bring a little calm with me (or make when I have stressful visitors). The tea bags come in individual packets, and I noticed that there was some powder from the tea bag left behind in many of them. One lick of the powder and it was unmistakably heavy in kava, so make sure to get all of it either in the cup or brave the awful taste and just lick the wrapper clean for the best effect! A bit of honey or agave nectar does a nice job of helping the flavor of this tea out, and a little milk makes it almost pleasant.

body: This tea is incredible! It's light, a little sweet, and a little minty (definitely not as strong as peppermint tea). I was an avid coffee/black tea drinker before my second pregnancy, and now a few weeks in, I'm drinking about 4 or 5 cups of this a day. I've noticed it eases my stomach, but it also gives me a little boost of energy because I feel refreshed after drinking a cup - of course, without the side effects of caffeine (which I so dearly miss, don't get me wrong!). I've noticed I don't crave sweets nearly as much - I don't know if that's from being pregnant or if it's from the tea. I don't sweeten this tea, but I bet it'd be even better with a little sugar or honey. And you certainly don't have to be pregnant to enjoy this tea - it's a nice, light, refreshing tea!
title: Incredible!

body: I am just over 25 weeks pregnant now and have just started drinking this tea alongside the mother-to-be tea that Yogi also makes.  I put one bag apiece in each cup and together they taste great.  It does make the tea a bit more bitter than when I was drinking the mother-to-be tea by itself, but I don't mind bitter teas and it's still a very mild taste.  The mother-to-be tea also contains ingredients other than the raspberry leaf and it helps give the mixture more flavor.  I drink a maximum of 3 cups a day and I will probably continue drinking it after the baby comes because I do have PCOS and the tea helps the female system in general.

I drank 3-4 cups a day as advised, basically after each nursing. I did add a little bit of milk in my tea (tea with sweetened condensed milk is a Russian remedy for increasing milk supply, but it didn't work for me anymore), because my stomach seemed to be upset with the tea without it. And I feel much less stressed out nowadays thanks to the lavender in the tea. I will definitely continue using it as long as I plan to nurse and will buy it again.

body: I started using this when I first started pumping, because it was frustrating to only get 2-3 oz per pumping session.  I started drinking 3-5 cups of this tea, and within a week, began to see a gradual increase until I hit 15 oz between my 2 sessions of pumping at work (I nurse when I'm with her).  I found that I could back off when I noticed my breasts getting overfull (the difference between a dry shirt at night, or not!).  This tea is super helpful when you notice your supply getting lower.  I start drinking a few cups a day again, and it goes back up within a week.  I got sick, and had to take some cold medicines, and my supply dropped off significantly.  Within a week of drinking 3-5 cups a day, it was back up.
title: Give it time, it does work!

body: I'm rating this a 5 because even though I'm not a huge fan of the taste, this tea does a great job of settling my stomach. I have IBS and even though I'm taking prescription medication, I often feel blegh after eating. I've noticed a big difference when I have a cup of this, especially with meals. Ginger really helps calm my stomach, but it's expensive and usually coated with sugar. This tea is a nice alternative. About the taste, it is a little bitter as you might expect upon reading the ingredients, but it's not too bad. They added barley malt as a sweetener, but I personally wish they hadn't as it seems a little sickly-sweet to me. Basically, I wouldn't drink this tea just for the taste, but it works well and it doesn't taste bad enough that it isn't highly worth it.
title: Taste just adequate but great results

body: This Sampler Pack has 4 different kinds of Yogi tea - all geared for people that are sick. The 4 kinds are: Breathe Deep, Throat Comfort, Echinacea Immune Support, and Cold Season. I have used all 4 kinds, to be honest, I think they all taste bad. None of them have a pleasant taste, but with a little bit of honey, most are tolerable. My reason for 5 stars, all ingredients are Organic and it is a more natural way to treat people that are sick instead of taking medicine. I do believe that they all have benefits - helping a sore throat, helping you to breathe more easily (congestion), and help to alleviate cold symptoms. Do they cure sickness? NO - but neither does medicine, these help by increasing your liquid intake when you are sick. As some other reviewers mentioned, many of these contain licorice root - which may impact blood pressure in some people. So if you have blood pressure problems you should consider carefully before using these products.
title: Very helpful for me and family with colds

body: I have been drinking a lot of this tea the last couple days since I received it. I feel like it helps with water retention, and my body is flushing a lot out since I have been drinking it. Also noticed some kidney soreness at the same time, as well as a constant need to drink more fluids. I'm not sure if that is due to the tea or something else in my life that has been affecting me, but it seems like this tea really helps with detoxification. IMO it tastes good too. I enjoy it without any sweeteners, and prefer it unsweetened. Also, one bad thing about the processing of the tea bags... The string is not stapled to the top. It's a manufacturing issue. The tea bags are NOT SEALED, and if you move it around too much when seeping, the loose crushed leaves will come out into the tea. The strings are not attached to the bags either. I just place the bags against the tea cup and the moisture allows the bags to cling to the side of the cups. I leave it for 10 mins or so, and then squeeze the liquid from the bags before removing them from the tea. Problem solved. It is still very worth the price and I will be purchasing again. Also, I have not had my period since drinking this tea, so I can't say anything about how the tea addresses the issue of PMS. I have bad PMS at times, with symptoms that include bad cramping and diarrhea, light-headedness, fatigue and low moods. It has been sporadic, with some months symptom free, and very painful during some months. I sure hope this tea helps... otherwise, I don't know what I'm gonna do when I have to work on the days I have PMS...

body: I absentmindedly bought this, not realizing it was so many bags of tea. You get 6 boxes with 16 bags in each (I know it's in the title but if I missed it someone else can too). It's okay though, because I kept two for myself (one at work and one for home) and gave out the other four to family members for Christmas. They thought it was a little weird to get laxative tea as a gift, but every one of them thanked me a few days later, saying they loved the taste and it worked as advertised. For me, it was a lifesaver in Turkey when my stomach was confused by jet lag and overeating, and provided immediate relief. Now that I'm back to a normal schedule, I have one regularly it helps keeps everything else regular. I don't normally like anything too minty, but the flavor is mild and I don't get sick of it.

body: I bought this tea to increase milk supply for my 9-month old twins. I could see the difference within a couple of days! The boys started nursing longer and I could pump more milk. I drank 3-4 cups a day as advised, basically after each nursing. I did add a little bit of milk in my tea (tea with sweetened condensed milk is a Russian remedy for increasing milk supply, but it didn't work for me anymore), because my stomach seemed to be upset with the tea without it. And I feel much less stressed out nowadays thanks to the lavender in the tea. I will definitely continue using it as long as I plan to nurse and will buy it again.
