body: Sarsaparilla, cinnamon, ginger, licorice, burdock, dandelion, cardamom, cloves and that's just half the list. I just recently got in touch with preventative herbal ideology and decided to get cloves, dandelion and ginger. Then I found this tea, and knew I had to order it. I'm not a picky eater, so I'm not the best person to ask about the taste, I say most things taste good. But I can testify to the efficacy of many of the ingredients listed here. If you like some of the other Yogi teas, you'll probably like this one to. It does have a kick to it (have you ever had fresh ginger?), but I like it, and I will continue to order it because it helps me relax and feel good.
title: The ingredients say it all!

body: I began drinking a cup a day in my third trimester, and tried to drink two a day in the ninth month. I keep the bag steeping the entire time I'm drinking. At 37 weeks I began supplementing this regimen with red raspberry leaf capsules. Never had Braxton Hicks or false labor, healthy baby was born one day shy of 39 weeks. He was my first baby but he came fairly fast (woke up at 1:00 a.m. with contractions, born at 6:17 a.m.). Labor and delivery was not nearly as painful as I expected -- I did it all without inducement or pain meds, and only spent 20 minutes pushing. I credit this tea and weekly aerobic yoga for the ease of my first childbirth experience. Will definitely drink again during future pregnancies!
title: Pleased this Preggo!

body: Because I believed the other reviewers claiming it was week and because I wanted a good nights sleep I put 2 bags in 1.5 cups of boiling water.  Added a lil sugar and when it cooled I sipped it - it smelled the whole kitchen up like cinnamon and spice - so whoever thinks this stuff is week is smoking crack!  I had to add another half cup of water just to drink it and yes I did get a slight tingle on my tounge.  Not sure if it helped me sleep or not. I used to drink Cammomile teas and have several I LOVE - but I finally found out that it was causing an allergy issue because I'm allergic to Ragweed (which almost everyone is) - and Cammomile is related - so I switched to Kava.  I made another cup tonight - 1 tea bag and it was much better - A lil spicy for me so I gave it 4 stars - I'm not a BIG tea drinker - only for medicinal purposes lol - so don't go by my judgement - but trust me it is strong. I'm going to try a few other sleep tea's that don't have cammomile in them - so while looking I felt I should set the record straight on this one's strength.
title: Don't believe the reveiws that claim its week. Very Cinnamony flavor and 2 teabags in 1 cup was WAY TOO STRONG

body: I bought this Tea originally by chance; I went to my local grocery store to by Mother's Milk which was the only nursing tea I had heard of. My grocery store was clearancing it out, and it was half the price as Mother's Milk, so I thought 'Why not try it?'. I was happy with my choice! The tea actually tastes quite decent, I add just one little packet of sugar to it (I'm not a huge tea fan to begin with). I haven't tried Mother's Milk, but I've heard it tastes terrible, so I was pleased with the taste of this tea as I'd been dreading trying nursing tea. I can't specifically say that this tea helps with milk production as I was working with a lactation specialist who also had me taking additional supplements at the same time. What I can say is that three times a day, I take a few moments to drink this tea, which boosts the amount of water I am consuming and lowers my stress level, two things that are very helpful when trying to boost your supply. I would highly recommend this tea, and I now purchase it from Amazon at a great rate.
title: Pleasant Taste

body: I've been breastfeeding exclusively for 8 months now, pumping at work, and I really think this tea has helped to maintain supply. I have been drinking 2-3 cups/ day of this tea (though sometimes I forget and have none). My daughter drinks alot more milk from bottles then when she breastfeeds, so keeping up with her daily ounces on daycare days can sometimes be a challenge. When I have a low pumping day, I up it to about 6 cups of this tea; I also try to drink more water, sometimes add oatmeal. Something works-- supply is back up in a day or two. I usually drink alot of water, so I do tend to attribute the increase in milk to this tea. And I like the taste. Price is right in cases of 6 from  Amazon, even cheaper if you do the auto shipments.
title: I think it works

body: Similar to many reviews - I started drinking this tea when I was 35 weeks pregnant. Drank for 2 weeks and the baby came a bit early - yet it was an amazingly easy and fast labor. It took me less than 30 minutes and I was fully dilated. I had to literally held the baby in so that my doctor could rush in to deliver him. LOL. And he was out in 3 pushes. Everyone was amazed how quick and smooth it was. I also had no tear. Like others said, I don't know for sure if it's really this tea, or genetics, or exercise (I did walk like at least 30 minutes a day), or luck or something else...but really, I can only see benefits of drinking this tea. I'll definitely drink again with my 2nd. Good luck everyone.

body: This tea is great. Like other reviewers I also suffer from anxiety/OCD, and have lots of trouble falling/staying asleep at night. Drinking this tea before bed is actually the most beneficial thing to help me sleep that I have tried (even more beneficial than melatonin, or actual prescription sleep medications). It helps slow the mind. I would agree with other reviews though, brew at least 2 bags if you're using it before bed (I've never tried more than 2)... 1 is good for during the day, but 2 really helps before bed time. This tea helped me cut down to waking up at least once an hour at night to only waking up once or twice. Highly recommend!!

Since this was my first child, I don't have anything to compare labor/contractions to, but I was induced at 41 weeks and the contractions were not as awful as I expected.  I can't say that this tea had any affect on my labor but I will definitely drink again during pregnancy #2.  It tastes good.

body: The box of yogi detox teas is a great deal on this brand so I thought I'd try it out. I've only drank it three times and I'll update my review. First impressions are that this is a pretty spicy tea if you follow directions exactly. One of the tea bags tasted more peppery than the other two so the taste will vary a little, a small amount of honey really cuts the bite. I drink it at night a little while after dinner. So far has kept me regular in the mornings and maybe it's making me retain a little less water than usual but I can't tell yet. I've been looking for a better priced detox tea and I'm hoping I found it.
title: Does what it says so far

body: I think this product actually works. I was didn't really believe it at first, but it actually did increase my milk supply. BUT you have to continue to take drink it. It's not like it works and then you can stop. What I do is make a big pot every morning and take it with me in a bottle. I try to remember to drink it all day. But this product does go bad really fast. I'm not sure why, but you can't just let it sit out all day. It starts to smell bad. I normally drink 2 -3 bags a day. Good Luck!!
title: It works!! But you have to keep drinking it for it to keep working...

body: I have never been a believer in any herbal teas until a coworker gave me a mug of BREATHE DEEP tea with honey last winter when I was coughing a lot.  Even one sip brought relief to my throat and by the time I had finished the mug, the coughing was over and done with.  I immediately went on a search for the product and finally found it in the gourmet section of a local grocery.  Then, I found it on Amazon... and a LOT less expensive!  BREATHE DEEP tea has not only helped me with my respiratory issues (asthma, bronchitis, chronic sinus congestion, etc.), I've shared it with family members and friends who are also amazed at what one cup of BREATHE DEEP tea can do.  I'm getting ready to order my supply for the upcoming winter.  I do NOT want to be caught without this in the cupboard.
title: Some seriously good stuff!

body: This herb tea has a wonderful, naturally sweet flavor. It is the sweetest herb tea I've ever tasted, making it one of my new top favorite blends. It's advertised to help the sinuses and lungs, but I like to drink it even when I don't need respiratory aid. It has an underpinning of very subtle, pure licorice flavor, so you might want to avoid it if you don't like licorice. The active ingredient is eucalyptus leaf, which does aid breathing. To enhance the taste, there is cinnamon, licorice, ginger, and peppermint. Medicinal herbs are also added, such as mullein. I always look forward to relaxing with a cup of this tea.
title: Natural, Sweet Herb Tea

This does not taste like coffee, but the creamy, sweet, vanilla hazelnut is a delightful morning treat. I also enjoy it after dinner. (Anyone remember Celestial Seasonings "After Dinner Teas"?) I make mine Bulletproof style in a 16oz Contigo, with a heaping tablespoon of coconut oil, a packet of Stevita, and about 1/3 cup of half-n-half or pure cream from my neighbor's cow.

body: well, here i am again in my 3rd trimester...and i did some research on the benefits of drinking raspberry leaf tea during this time...and apparently for women it's good to drink just in general, pregnate or not.  so, being a yogi tea lover i ordered a box.  i find it very convinient to be able to buy a 6 pack (16 bags per box) at this price b/c it averages out to about 2 dollars less than you pay per box at whole foods or other grocery stores.  also, i dont worry about running out in a week.  i like to double up the tea bags, i drink about 4 cups per day.  it tastes great in my opinion, and today i just added a fresh lemon from my lemon tree!  delicious!!  as far as the benefits for my uterous i cant really comment on since i'm not a obgyn, and i havent had my baby yet so i dont know if this tea will play any part in easing my labor.  but i can tell you that i love this tea, it tastes great, it makes me feel like i'm doing something good for my body & it's a great price.  i will continue to drink it after giving birth b/c from what i've read there are also post partum benefits of drinking raspberry leaf tea.

body: I started drinking this tea when I was about 26 weeks pregnant, and after checking with my OB to be sure it was safe. I'd read that raspberry leaf tea can help shorten labor by strengthening your uterus, and I was all for trying that! The tea, in my opinion, was quite terrible-tasting (I drank it black), but it (or the 5 dates a day I ate for the last 6 weeks of pregnancy) helped-I was only in labor for a total of 8.5 hours! A warning, though-my amniotic fluid levels were low at 37 weeks, and again at 40 weeks (which is why they decided to induce), and one possible reason might have been the diuretic effect of the tea. Just be sure to keep that in mind!

body: I can't get enough of this tea! The experience starts when you tear open the envelope and inhale the gorgeous aromas of cinnamon, cloves and ginger. Continue enjoying the calming scent as your tea steeps in the hot water and meditat on the little pearl of wisdom written on each tag. Finally, in 3 to 5 minutes when you drink your tea, you'll start to realize while no other green chai tea will ever measure up again. This is the best - truly, therapy in a cup. But please note: if you're not used to chai tea, it may take a few cups to get used to - I think it's a little stronger than other chai. The traditional way to drink this is with sweetener and a little milk, although I prefer mine with just hot water. Often I will throw a thimble-sized amount of peeled and chopped fresh ginger root into my mug and leave it in there as an extra health and flavor boost while I drink my tea. Heavenly!

body: I didn't really expect to see results with this product, but I got desperate. I tried stopping birth control (after 6 years) 4 months ago and ended up developing cystic acne, so I freaked out and went back on birth control. Fast forward 2 months later-- tried going off it again and this time, I wanted to prepare myself for the hormonal flux. I drank this tea 2-3 times a day for a month and when my period finally came around-- mind you I had severe nausea from the hormones, loss of appetite and extreme fatigue from going off the pill. Despite all those side effects of stopping the pill, I had my first normal period (4 days instead of 9) in 6 years, i didn't have a huge acne breakout and no crying spells! Super great results and expecting the bad side effects of the pill to go away in a couple months... cheers to hormone free, holistic health and hope you find healing as well!
title: menstrual regulation, acne control

body: I never write reviews but I must! I started depo in 2016 and it completely stopped me periods. I only took one shot and decided depo was not for me due to the hormones. (It made me utterly emotional!) So after the three months were up, I switched to the Copper IUD because it contains no hormones. Six months later and my period had not returned. This made me uneasy and so I did some research on how to bring it back naturally. I made a list of herbs during my research and when I finally felt informed enough, I went on amazon and was ready to buy them all. To my surprise, this tea contained them all and more! I got this one week ago and took it three times a day. I also bought Yogi's Raspberry leaf tea and would alternate. Moon cycle contains raspberry leaf tea already but I wanted more of it. Well, these two teas brought my period back within a week! I recommend them to anyone with the same problem.

I must say that it has helped with the severe tension headaches that work and kid give me daily, especially when trying to go to sleep. It is nice to be able to use a natural product to help myself with my anger management problems instead of loading up on medications.

body: I am not a fan of tea. I do not normally drink the stuff, any flavor, any type, for any symptom. BUT, I am now a believer. This tea is amazing. I suffer from severe cramps (Yes, I do cry because of it.. I even sometimes ask my sister to punch me in the stomach so that it would take away from the pain!). I have tried prescription pain medication and birth control to alleviate my pain. The prescription pain meds always made me sleepy (which is terrible while I'm at work, or need to drive) and for personal reasons I am not on birth control at the moment. When I wasn't taking either, I would take between 6-10 ibuprofen each day for the first 2 days of my cycle. Don't get me wrong, I still have to take it, but not nearly as much. So far, I have only drank the tea during the cycle, usually about 5 bags each day. I have done this for the past 3 months. But, I am going to start drinking it throughout the month... I'm hoping it will help the initial monstrous pain I get when my cycle decides to surprise me.
title: Cramps be gone

body: I had been taking a low dose prescription drug to help me stay asleep at night.  I would often wake up in the middle of the night two or three times.  I wouldn't consider myself an insomniac but just wanted to stay asleep all night.  I have been using two tea bags in a large mug and drinking it about 30 minutes prior to going to bed.  I find myself falling asleep easily and staying asleep all night.  I'm cutting down and eliminating my prescription drug altogether.  It works!
title: Sleepy time

body: I like to let this steep until it's a tad bit warmer than room temperature, it tastes best that way to me. I don't use this as a particular cleanse. I drink a cup or two a day just because of the quality ingredients and I do happen to like the flavor best of all the "detox" teas.
title: I like to let this steep until it's a tad bit ...

body: I have been drinking this Lemon Ginger tea in such quantities that I figured I should buy stock in it. Have loved it until now! And been drinking it daily. Yesterday I made myself a travel much with a bag of it and went in town. When I took a sip I concluded I had mistakenly put in a bag of my partner's tea because the flavor was not Lemon Ginder at all. I thought no more of it until this morning when I opened my last box of Lemon Ginger (while thinking I had to get on Amazon and order another box of 6) and then when I took a sip I stopped short and went to see what tea bags I had used because it tasted like licorice and NOTHING like GINGER and LEMON. What happened? I have been drinking this for the better part of a year and it has been consistently a GINGER LEMON tea flavor. They Must have changed the proportions if not the actual ingredients... There is no ginger OR lemon flavor in it. It tastes like licorice and black pepper. I looked through my cabinet for an older box to see if the ingredients had been altered but I don't have an old box to compare. If this is the "new" formula or flavor I am moving on.... Bummer ! I really have enjoyed the tea the way it was for the last 10 months...
title: DID they CHANGE the FORMULA??? : (

I like to brush my teeth before I drink this just to make sure I get all the flavor possible.This tea is the perfect post dinner bedtime treat which I use on a regular basis. I am a very high strung and energetic person, this tea really helps relax my mind and body before bed, I always get a solid nights rest after having one or two cups of this tea. I have a couple friends that have had very hard times sleeping, I introduce them to this tea and they instantly were more relaxed and getting better sleep than they have in years, they use this regularly as well. I have been buying this product for the better half of a decade now through local stores but have switched to buying it in bulk from Amazon at a discounted rate.
title: Best Pre Bedtime Treat Ever!

body: I love to have a cup or two of this as the evening winds down after dinner.  I love the slightly sweet, mildly "licorice" taste of it, and I am always sleepy by the time I am ready for bed. I look forward to it every day.

body: I know what Ginger tastes like and this is NOT Ginger. The only things I found pleasant about this tea is that it came in a beautiful box and the individual packs were nicely packaged, I don't care whether this is organic or not, the flavor of Ginger is absolutely absent. If you appreciate the aroma and strong flavor of good cup of Ginger tea then try "Prince of Peace" Honey Ginger Crystals. The aroma lights up the room, the flavor is strong and authentic and since they are crystals, there are no tea bags to deal with and the result is a good clean cup of genuine Ginger tea.
title: NO GOOD!!!!

body: I was introduced to Kava or AWA drink in Maui.  The first cup is like drinking liquid earth, but I developed a taste for it.  It really works to help relax aching muscles.  I can make my own AWA, but it is time consuming.  I tried this tea and with the carob and cinnamon it is delicious.  I love it.  I buy it from Amazon in the larger quantity because it is cheaper, even with shipping, than buying in a health food or grocery store if they even have it.
title: I love this tea.

body: I've been drinking Yogi teas for years, and I think this blend is my favorite of them all. It soothes sour stomachs, eases cold symptoms, eases allergies. It's also nice to drink just because. The taste is a bit spicy because of the ginger, but the combination with lemon helps to neutralize some of that. To give you an idea of how happy I am with this product, I've ordered a new six pack of teas after receiving my last shipment just three months ago. My household goes through these very quickly.
title: Can't recommend this enough!

After reading all the reviews I wasn't sure if I'd be able to try this thinking it would just taste too nasty. I brewed my first cup and really liked it. I didn't put any honey etc. the first time because I wanted to see how it was first. I DO NOT like black licorice at all and I was happy that I didn't taste any and the flavor is spicy I like that. I tried it with honey and had to choke it down quick! The after taste is the stevia root that gives it a mentholated lingering in the back of your throat. I've tried stevia before and hated every second of it. This is more of a mild taste that isn't overpowering and doesn't linger longer than I appreciate. With the honey it lingered like the Dickens! I had a few co-workers try it and one thought it was spicy like I did and the other couldn't get over the earthiness, which I didn't taste, and the lingering stevia root at the end.I would suggest trying it before adding any sweetner.

I purchased this seeing that it is a Prime candidate but after several days found that they are going to sit on my order for a week before shipping it and then it will still be three days from the ship date for me to receive it (I should add that I live in a major city so it is not an ordeal for them to get it to me). Two-day shipping touted by Amazon when trying to sell their Prime service is a lie.  If, like me, you rely on this product and have a hard time finding it in the stores be sure to reorder with ample padding for every party involved to drag their feet.

Not only does it help with pain, but my period only lasts about 3-4 days rather than 5-6 and it is lighter. I guess you can't believe it until you try it. Two-day shipping touted by Amazon when trying to sell their Prime service is a lie.  If, like me, you rely on this product and have a hard time finding it in the stores be sure to reorder with ample padding for every party involved to drag their feet.

body: I bought this tea for mothers day only to find out that you must "consult a doctor if you are taking medications or have a medical condition", therefore my mother couldn't drink this. After all, I've tried it myself, and I must say the taste is great, but the effects are horrendous. I drank a cup one morning and headed out to school. Barely got an hour in the day after I started to experience rapid heartbeat and lightheaded feelings. I do NOT have any medical condition whatsoever, yet I did not consult a doc before drinking it because well...how bad can a mixture of organic plants in a tea bag be? Anyway, I thought it was temporary, I had a second cup a couple days later and the same thing happens. As for a pick me up, I would say this tea goes all the way but I think coffee is the more conventional thing to choose! I don't chug my tea so I wouldn't see why this would happen. I've yet to go to the doctor about this. 3 stars because its organic ingredients and flavor, but if you want to TRY the tea, aim for the single pack before you spend a bunch on this and end up returning it *(which is my case).
title: I don't know about this tea

body: Drank my first cup of tea right now. It's delicious! I'm a huge fan of tea and trying out different types. After seeing the reviews on here I had to try it! My new favorite tea! Helps with cleansing the body and I even lost a few inches by drinking this with a healthier diet of course. Absolutely wonderful spiced flavor and so enlightening!
title: Such a great tea!

body: This tea is quite tasty!  I didn't mind drinking it multiple times a day.  I started drinking this tea as soon as I reached 3rd trimester in my pregnancy (even though it is safe all througout pregnancy).  Toward the end I was drinking 3+ cups a day.  It is hard to say if it did any good.  I was in labor for 80 hours with my son, which resulted in a c-section... but that was due to him being in a poor position.  I don't think it did any harm by any means and I will drink it again when I get pregnant again.

body: I have tried nearly all of Yogi's Green teas, and LOVED them all, up until this one. I was very disappointed that I wasted so much money on it. Please, do yourself a favor and find a local store to buy one of these in a single pack to make sure you like it. Or just go with a better tea like Yogi's Pure Green, Super Antioxidant, or Muscle Recovery. Those all taste amazing and I have multiple cups of each of them every day!
title: Very disappointed.

body: Yogi carries a number of teas that are good for something specific. I'm skeptical of most, but I have to say that I always feel a little more calm after a cup of Kava tea. It is difficult to describe how this tea feels in your mouth, but it is something close to the feeling of putting lotion on after a long day. Some teas leave my mouth feeling dry, others make me want to brush my teeth, but this tea winds me down for cozying up in bed. I wouldn't let it steep for too long because it can be very strong and be ready to relax!
title: I feel better already.

body: Yogi Tea company seems to be spot on with their teas, and this DeTox is no exception. I've been drinking this tea several times a week, regularly for the last year. I can say that the taste is wonderful - one of my favorites. Adding a tiny amount of Stevia in the Raw makes it perfect for my personal taste.  I am not sure about the internal workings of the detoxification process, but I can say with certainty that this tea will make you urinate much more than usual. Having said that, I would limit drinking close to bedtime. Enjoy!

body: I couldn't wait to get this tea because of all the great reviews. No one has said how it tasted so either it tastes really good or it works so good no one cares about the flavor. Well let me be the one to say the taste is as nasty as it could be. It's like drinking a warm cup of celery but worse. I do have to say that it works great BUT it doesn't last very long. Too much tea makes me shaky and gives me a stomachache even without caffeine so I can't drink this all day. After the first 2 days I gave up on it and went back to Advil because I'd have to take it anyway. It didn't help my bloating or my irritability. It really helped with cramping while it lasts. I put a lot French vanilla creamer and honey in it and it tasted pretty good. Too bad it doesn't last long because I thought it was a lifesaver while it was working!
title: Warm cup o' celery anyone??

body: I'm attempting to relactate and have been taking this along with Fenugreek daily. The tea isn't the best tasting, but I can stand it for the sake of my son. This, combined with Fenugreek, has begun to slowly up my supply. I seem to be producing a bit more milk, after going over a month without bf'ing. I also love the little mantras on each packet. They always make me smile and keep me motivated to keep trying to relactate for my son.

body: St John's wort takes a month or so to begin working in the body so don't expect immediate results. This tea has been a life saver. body: I was looking for green tea supplements that offered appetite surpressing and detox.  I always read the reviews of AMAZON and find them very helpful.  There were a few people who rated this product below a three, but more than not it was rated 4 or 5.  I understand why! The fasting herbal supplement has a good flavor and a little sweet taste at the end.  I am drinking it every day and find that I am eating less.  I do have more energy and I am moving away from coffee to drinking more tea daily.  I love it and I don't believe that alone I will lose weight, but as part of an overall better eating plan it will help me pass up some of the sweet stuff over the holiday season and beyond.  Good product.
title: It's more than I expected

body: I've been drinking Yogi teas for years, and I think this blend is my favorite of them all. It soothes sour stomachs, eases cold symptoms, eases allergies. It's also nice to drink just because. The taste is a bit spicy because of the ginger, but the combination with lemon helps to neutralize some of that. To give you an idea of how happy I am with this product, I've ordered a new six pack of teas after receiving my last shipment just three months ago. My household goes through these very quickly.

body: I began drinking this tea as soon as I was out of my first trimester (I'm nearly done with my second now).  I was warned that it might not taste so good but I love it.  It has a nice minty flavor that resembles the regular peppermint teas that are available.  There is also a natural lemon flavor added according to the box but I really don't taste it that much.  I don't need sweeteners or anything and it isn't a chore at all to drink the 3 daily cups.  I also bought the red raspberry leaf tea and I will add that once my due date is closer.
title: Tastes great and soothing!

body: This tea gave me an instant jump start in energy after 2 days of drinking multiple cups a day. The taste reminds me of a cinnamon Christmas type tea. I added raw honey to mine and that made it so much better! This is a great value for the cost!
title: I added raw honey to mine and that made it so much better! This is a great value for the cost

body: I was given a box of this tea in my breastfeeding class before my son was born.  Since then, I have been addicted to this tea.  Not only does it taste good, but it is helping to keep my supply going.  I notice a significant difference in the amount of milk I'm able to pump when I've been regularly drinking this tea vs. when I get really busy and have only a cup every other day or so.  Literally, when I drink my three cups a day, after about 3-4 days, I can pump out almost 40 oz a day.  When I drink only a cup here or there, I'm lucky for 25-28 oz.  I don't know if that swing in milk production can be attributed directly to this tea, but for me, it works and I enjoy the taste of the tea.  I figure, it can't hurt and since I'm planning to breastfeed for 1 year+, I need all the help I can get.
title: Keeps Your Supply Going

body: Drank 4 cups a day beginning at 28 weeks of pregnancy up until the day of delivery. Sometimes drank it iced and sometimes hot. Drank a hot large cup on the way to the hospital that was steaped for a good 20 mins.  It was my first pregnancy and had a rather easy delivery and dilated from a 4 to a 10 in about a 1/2 hour. Also, I didn't have any painful contractions after delivery during breastfeeding. Not sure if I can credit the tea but it sure doesn't hurt to try!! I will be drinking this tea with my future pregnancies as well. Enjoy!
title: Love it

body: I saw the rave reviews for this tea, and I decided to do an experiment and try this tea along with the Traditional Medicinals St. John's Wort Good Mood tea. They should have been similar, although it looks like the Yogi tea has more St. John's Wort in it. I've had several cups of both now, and without a doubt the Yogi tea tastes way too licoricey and like it has a fake sweetener in it. The Traditional Medicinals tastes WAY better to me, with a more subtle licorice flavor and no weird fake sweetener taste. Also, it makes me feel better than the Yogi tea. It gives me a little boost, which I'm not feeling with Yogi. Sorry, but I tried it a few times to make sure! If anyone else wants to try the same experiment, I'd be interested in your opinion as well!!!
title: Ugggg. The taste...

body: I really like the flavor of the ginger tea especially if you put a little bit of honey in with it.  I have IBS and sometimes food doesn't always agree with me. body: I have been using Benefiber for years and it was getting very expensive. I have a difficult time trying to have "regular bowel" movements so adding more fiber to my diet was important. I recently gave up red meat and it caused me to skip almost 3 days before I could go... Anyway, this tea is amazing. I drink it at night around 8pm and I have a bowel movement the next morning around 7:30am. It has allowed me to loose 3 pounds this past week. :) I am quite addicted to this now. I am not sure if that is a good thing or a bad thing but in any case, it works! I have also tried the Detox tea and it does the same for me. I just prefer the taste of this tea better. Great purchase! Way less expensive on Amazon than in the local stores. About a 40% savings.

body: Sarsaparilla, cinnamon, ginger, licorice, burdock, dandelion, cardamom, cloves and that's just half the list. I just recently got in touch with preventative herbal ideology and decided to get cloves, dandelion and ginger. Then I found this tea, and knew I had to order it. I'm not a picky eater, so I'm not the best person to ask about the taste, I say most things taste good. But I can testify to the efficacy of many of the ingredients listed here. If you like some of the other Yogi teas, you'll probably like this one to. It does have a kick to it (have you ever had fresh ginger?), but I like it, and I will continue to order it because it helps me relax and feel good.
title: The ingredients say it all!

body: I'm 23 and had a hormonal imbalance where i would  not get my period. My doctor immediately said, well here is some birth control for you. I tried the pills and got sick (nausea/migranes/stomach aches). I wanted something natural, so i decided to do some research online and bumped into this tea. I read some good reviews so i decided to give it a try. I have never really been a tea drinker so the initial taste was horrid but since i was hoping to get better i decided to drink it anyways. I started getting my period naturally after 3 months of drinking this cup of tea with two tea bags everyday. I guess it depends on the severity of your imbalance, some people say they see a difference within days or weeks. Bottom line is it has worked for me, i am still using it and will continue using it. Yes i recommend it! :)

body: Drank it everyday in the months before labor, and my contractions were so crazy and had no sense of pattern at all, all the way up to delivery. (I did have a very smooth labor and delivery other than that though. But I ate at Denny's 10 days before my due date, and started getting contraction right after eating. (Had baby soon after) I didn't think anything of it until we went back a couple months later with baby, and the waitresses all swore that many women have told them that they went into labor after eating there..... Lol. So for all you pregnant women, take that however you want.. Either avoid Denny's or rush your butt over there and get labor started! ;P
title: Ehh

body: I'm sorry...I tried really hard to like this tea but in the end it tasted like licking a shoe. Unless you add a whole lot of sugar to it it is very difficult to choke down. There are a multitude of better tasting herbal teas out there, this particular combination is really, really bad.
title: Tastes like licking a shoe!

body: I was SO excited to have found tea that tastes like aveda tea without the price. Based on the high reviews, I figured I would give this tea a try... I just received this tea and it tastes NOTHING like Aveda tea. It does not that that great licorice after-taste that makes you want to have another sip like Aveda tea. This tea also has cinnamon which is not in the Aveda tea at all. Overall, I would NOT recommend this tea to anyone who is looking for Aveda tea. It is very minty and has cinnamon in it.
title: NOTHING like Aveda Tea

body: I received the wrong Yogi tea on my Subscribe & Save.  I received the Yogi Egyptian Licorice Mint (green box) instead of the plain Yogi Egyptian Licorice (purple box).  I used it--but please be cognizant in the future of not allowing this mistake to occur. Thanks.
title: Product mistake made on Subscription

body: This tea is fantastic. For as long as I remember, I've suffered from terrible cramps, jitters, and other unpleasant PMS symptoms. This tea knocks them right out. I've found after drinking a cup, I have less of a need to take ibuprofen or other OTC pain killers, as well as feeling much more calm and relaxed. I'm starting to suspect that it's made out of unicorn tears and rainbows, because it is that magical.
title: Excellent Product
